1.content: Who is the main character for you?
1.title: The hero is,,,,

11.content:
Name: Terror Grey-Mane
Species: Argonian (Werewolf)
Age: 10
Size: 4 ft (6 ft as Werewolf)
Gender:
Magic/Powers: Beast Form, Shadow attack, Healing
Skills: Pickpocketing, Sneaking, Lockpicking
Weapon: Dual Steel Daggers
Description: Wears worn clothing and a green cape.
His clothes are worn & torn due to the Grey-mane's lack of wealth
Black scales with patches of red on his face. Wears footwraps.
Two small horns on head and red feathers.
[Character I made it was inspired off: http://fav.me/d5s7hwc ]
[Pixel art made by a friend: http://fav.me/d5wog7g ]

Biography:
Was originally found by Eorlund Grey-Mane on the street in Whiterun when he was a baby. Eorlund noticed he was hurt and took him back to his home. The Grey-Manes took him in and welcomed him to the family. He was raised the way Nord are but still has some argonian skills. He learned to be a thief and to sneak with great skill when he was old enough. At 8 years of age he found out he was a werewolf by accident when he accidentally transformed when going for a walk at night. He was able to keep it hidden though and kept it a secret.

Where is he now?
11.title: Terror Grey-Mane

112.content: As a werewolf carefully Jumped from roof to roof in Whiterun silently, those below were unaware. You then transformed back when you noticed a guard below. You fell down silently and reached into his pockets and grabbed his coin purse. You then retreated to the shadows. You had looked inside and found 5 septims. Enough for a decent meal at the Drunken Huntsman. "Score...," you said as you smiled and walked off to the Drunken Huntsman.
112.title: Out at night

choices: Going to whiterun to sell goods
12.content:
Name: Kiba
Species: Argonian
Age: 17
Size: 5’7”
Gender: Male
Magic: Conger familiar, Flaming familiar, Ice needle
Skills: Conjuring, Destruction, Alchemy
Weapon: Duel Bound Swords
Description: Green scales with blue around the face and blue feathers. Wears a mage robe and hood with fur gloves and boots.

Biography: Found by the dock workers in Windhelm on a cargo boat, he was raised in the Argonian assemblage as a little hatchling. He was a skilled mage so he has always aimed to perfect his craft. One day he found a wolf injured in a trap and tried to help it. Unable to heal him he contained the wolfs soul in a crystal to save it, and he has kept him as his familiar/pet and companion. He constantly travels now in order to make money to support his family, by making potions for sell, hunting game, or Takeing jobs.

What is he doing now?
12.title: Kiba

121.content: After a long day of gathering you are walking to Whiterun with a large amount of supplies and your wolf familiar walking by your side. Your familiar growls to you as you near the city gates. "It's alright Tsume" You say calmly "We are just going to sell some stuff and rest a bit." As you enter Whiterun you look up and the full moon. "It is quite butiful tonight." You say as you walk to the Drunken Huntsman.
121.title: Going to whiterun to sell goods

13.content:
Name: Claire Delgreind
Race: Dunmer
Age: 24
Height: 72"
Gender: Female

Magic:
-Destruction: Fire Rune, Fire Storm, Fireball, Firebolt, Flames, Frost Cloak, Frostbite, Ice Spike, Icy Spear, Incinerate, Lightning Bolt, Lightning Rune, Sparks, Wall of Flames.
-Illusion: Calm, Clairvoyance, Fear, Fury, Hysteria, Invisibility, Muffle, Rally, Rout, Vision of the Tenth Eye.
-Conjuration: Bound Battleaxe, Bound Sword, Command Daedra, Conjure Ash Guardian, Conjure Boneman, Conjure Familiar, Conjure Flame Atronach, Conjure Frost Atronach, Conjure Seeker, Flame Thrall, Flaming Familiar, Raise Zombie, Reanimate Corpse, Soul Trap, Summon Arvak, Summon Unbound Dremora.
-Alteration: Candlelight, Detect Life, Dragonhide, Ebonyflesh, Equilibrium, Magelight, Oakflesh, Paralyze, Stoneflesh, Telekinesis, Transmute.
-Restoration: Bane of the Undead, Grand Healing, Healing, Healing Hands, Lesser Ward, Steadfast Ward, Turn Greater Undead, Turn Lesser Undead.

Shouts: Animal Allegiance, Aura Whisper, Battle Fury, Become Etheral, Bend Will, Call Dragon, Call of Valor, Clear Skies, Cyclone, Disarm, Dismay, Dragon Aspect, Dragonrend, Drain Vitality, Elemental Fury, Fire Breath, Frost Breath, Ice Form, Kyne's Peace, Marked for Death, Slow Time, Soul Tear, Storm Call, Summon Durnehviir, Throw Voice, Unrelenting Force, Whirlwind Sprint.

Powers: Ancestor's Wrath, Black Market, Mora's Boon, Secret of Arcana, Summon Karstaag.

Equipment: Legendary Daedric Armor set, which has an armor rating of 1378 without a shield (Helmet enchantment: +40% to Archery damage, waterbreathing; Armor enchantments: +62 health, stamina regen +31%; Gauntlet enchantments: Sneak +40%, Bow damage +40%; Boots enchantments: Resist fire +46%, Resist Frost +46%); Gold Jeweled Necklace (Smithing +25%, Fortify Carry weight +37); Silver Sapphire Necklace (Resist Frost +52%, Resist Shock +52%); Gold Diamond Ring (Carrying Capacity +41, Resist Shock +51%); Dragonbone Bow of Chaos Flames (Legendary) (217 physical damage (279 when wearing helmet) + the damage of an arrow, 31 Fire damage, 50% chance of causing 48 Fire, Shock, and Frost damage), Dragonbone Sword of Chaos Flames (Legendary) (140 physical damage, 31 Fire damage, 50% chance of causing 48 Fire, Shock, and Frost damage), Dragonbone Sword of Chaos Flames (Legendary) (140 physical damage, 31 Fire damage, 50% chance of causing 48 Fire, Shock, and Frost damage), thousands of arrows, from Iron, Steel and Ancient Nord, to Daedric, Enhanced Dwarven Crossbow (Legendary) (109 physical damage, ignores 50% of armor).

Biography: Orphaned after her parents died in a house fire, she was handed off to one of her father's friends who raised her until she left to wander Tamriel, starting with trying out Guilds in Cyrodiil.

Where is she now?
13.title: [Notify for Name]

choices: Spying on Khajiit and Thalmor in Elsweyr.
135.content: Where else could she be?
135.title: Somewhere else.

1352.content:
Claire was headed south into Elsweyr, toward her destination of Torval. Her desert cloak tried to escape from her body due to strong gusts of wind in a powerful wind storm. Although the dust storm provided her with cover from the sun it was hot, and the sandy soil constantly getting into her armor wasn't helping. The silhouette of a town appeared some distance ahead of her A sign pointing to it read Meir Lynmount. She proceeded her heading toward the town, and when she was only a few tens of meters away, the dust storm died down. She removed her hood, and Khajiit began walking out of their homes to uncover food and weapon stalls. Whenever a Khajiit would spot her, the first thing they would notice would be Claire's helmet, and slowly back away. She proceeded to the town's inn, and took a seat at a table in the middle of the room. A Khajiiti server came up to her.

"E-excuse me, sir," he began with a stutter. "Is there anything I can get you?"

"Just a bottle of ale and, if you have any, a horker loaf," Claire said, as she handed the Khajiit a small bag of coins. He was shocked to find that who he thought was a man, was in fact a woman. Claire removed her Daedric helmet, revealing her face to the young Khajiit. She had pale skin with a slight, blue tinge and white hair that only reached down just past her ears, with a few strands in front of her left ear, as well as silver lips and eyes red as flawless garnet.

"Right away, miss," he said. He came back moments later with her food and drink.
1352.title: Spying on Khajiit and Thalmor in Elsweyr.

13522.content:
Name: Dadeli
Race: Khajiit (Werewolf)
Sex: Male
Height: 5'9 (6'5 as werewolf)
Appearance: Dadeli has yellow/blond fur with a few black and white splotches on his body. His brown hair hangs down behind his head. Wears a cloak similar to the ones worn in Hammerfell. Has a Cursed ring of Hircine and Upgraded gloves with a 100% more Unarmed damage.
Weapons: Claws, Enhanced Dwarven Crossbow.
Powers: Beast Form, Night Sight.
Best stats: Sneaking, Pickpocket, Lockpicking, Light Armor.

Bio: A skooma addict, Dadeli hangs out in low places, such as Riften's Ratways, Markarth's Understone Keep, ruins, etc. If he's not there, check the forests, prisons, or don't search since he could be a wandering werewolf. At many times, Dadeli can't control his transformations because of the ring. Dadeli is surprisingly kind and is not a real drunkard, but just drinks Skooma because he likes it.

He traveled with a Caravan as defense for some time before he left to explore. While with the caravan, he picked up a bit of archery and sneaking tips. After leaving, he got into quite a few brawls and was able to become quite skilled in hand-to-hand combat. He even won his gloves from a man in the Ratways. He also became a skilled thief, even rivaling the Thieves Guild's best.

-------------

Dadeli burst through the door and let a roar out. He didn't want to do this, but the blood called him, the ring called him, Hircine called him. Dadeli let out a primal roar as he looked at what was on the menu. Normal khajiit as usual, but there was something else now. A dark elf. She looked like a well enough meal. Dadeli rushed toward her but before he knew it, she was gone. He turned and roared as he saw a figure run out of the door and followed in a a sprint. The figure ran until they were far enough away, and turned and placed a helmet on and pulled two blades out. Dadeli roared and charged.
13522.title: Something happens.

choices: It connects and he wins the fight.
135221.content: A gust of wind tore Claire's desert robe from her armor, revealing a gleaming set of black and red armor, worn on a tall, slender body. She charged Dadeli, and when he brought his claws down on her, she side-stepped and left a deep gash in his arm and back. Enraged, Dadeli spun around and swung at Claire.
135221.title: The fight

1352211.content:
Dadeli's claw tore through Claire's chest with the sound of flesh tearing. She flew back and rammed into a hill of sand. The sand began to turn red as Claire was losing consciousness. Dadeli charged at her when his vision blurred and he fell as his body returned to normal. He picked himself off of the dusty ground in only his pants as his chest garbs tore off. "Wh...what..?" Dadeli began when he saw Claire in the sand bleeding. "Oh no...."

Dadeli ran next to her and picked her up. She was breathing. Dadeli them heard a loud noise and saw another sandstorm coming. They needed to get inside now. Dadeli carried her to his home. Dadeli's home consisted of a dugout cave in the side of a large dune with a bedroll on the ground and a few cabinets and just enough room for a fire. He laid Claire down and stood before bandaging his claw wounds he gave her and bandaging his own arm room. "...Hope she doesn't kill me when she wakes up..." He said to himself.
1352211.title: It connects and he wins the fight.

choices: ...watching her from a far corner of the room.
13522111.content: Claire shot awake to excruciating pain in her chest, and struggled to cast Grand Healing, whereupon the gash healed to a shallow cut. She cast Fast Healing to completely close it. She began unraveling the bandages, and as she was halfway done, noticed someone was in the room. It was a Khajiit, and he was...
13522111.title: Claire wakes up

135221112.content:
Dadeli was dozing off to the sound of the sandstorm trapping the two of them inside when he saw Claire when she healed her wounds and began to unbandage herself when she saw him. He stood and walked closer, "Are you alright there?"

"Who are you, and what happened?" Claire asked with curiosity.

"I'm Dadeli. I...erm..." He was thinking about not telling her, but did anyway. "...I was the werewolf that hurt you. I didn't mean to though! This accursed ring did it. But you tore my arm open and I knocked you out, then I turned back. I brought you here, my home, and patched you up. I hope it helped..." Dadeli finished.

What does Claire do?
135221112.title: ...watching her from a far corner of the room.

1352211122.content: "What are you doing all the way down here with the Cursed Ring of Hircine?" Claire asked.
1352211122.title: Claire questions him

13522111221.content:
"I traveled Skyrim for some time in a caravan. We were down by Falkreath when I spotted something farther in the woods and went after it. It looked like a giant stag, so I hunted it and killed it. Then I heard Hircine speaking to me. He gave me this for hunting the stag and since then I haven't been able to control the beast that was already in me. I fled from the caravan and travel from time-to-time. I try to stay away from cities just in case, but I visit sometimes." Dadeli finished. He looked out and saw the sandstorm still blowing outside. "What's a dark elf doing here anyway?"

What happens next?
13522111221.title: He explains.

135221112211.content: "I am currently spying for the Empire," Claire began. "Because I prefer to where non-uniform armor, it will be easier for me to pass off as a wanderer. The only reason I'm telling you this is because you don't look like you're working with or for anyone. Gotta hand it to you, though. No werewolf has been able to tear through my armor like that. They all wound up breaking something. Speaking of, do you by chance have a forge here that I can repair my armor?"
135221112211.title: Claire explains

1352211122112.content:
"There's no forge nearby that we can get to quickly. But..." Dadeli then pulled a knapsack from the side of his home and opened it to show a Daedra Heart ebony ingots, along with a few tools. "...I may be able to patch it up. May I see it?"

Claire laid her armor down as Dadeli began to mend the wound close. "Imperial, you say? So am I. They may not know about my transformations, but I'm still in the Imperial Legion. Still, I'm curious as to why you're out here. Who are you spying on?"

Does Claire tell him?
1352211122112.title: "No."

13522111221122.content: "I'm sorry," Claire began. "But that information is confidential, and I can't say at the risk of another war starting with the Thalmor before the Empire is ready to exploit any weaknesses they may have. When you are done repairing my armor, I will be on my way."
13522111221122.title: No

135221112211221.content:
Dadeli closed up the last hole in Claire's armor before handing it back to her. "There you go....Hey, before you go, you think I could tag along? I mean I can be of use, we're both Imperial, and I know my way around here. So could I accompany you?"

What does Claore decide?
135221112211221.title: Option 1.

choices: The storm lifts after a while and they head out.
1352211122112211.content: "Even though you have an obvious Skooma addiction, uncontrollable Lycanthropy, and tried to kill me, I guess the reward outways the risk. Barely," Claire said. "As soon as the storm lifts, we move. I would use my Clear Skies Shout, but if there happen to be any Thalmor in the area, and knowing my luck, there will be, they will come to investigate. They know I have the ability to Shout, but they don't know my face, despite me being a Dunmer."
1352211122112211.title: Yes

13522111221122111.content:
Dadeli filled his knapsack that he was taking with him with a few things: Skooma, some extra crossbow bolts, a few potions and some books along with all his gold. The storm passed a little bit later and he stood facing Claire. "I'm ready," Dadeli said as Claire simply nodded and they entered back into the desert.

They walked for awhile before Dadeli spoke up. "Hey, I'm sorry about me trying to kill you."

Claire just kept walking. "Just forget about it."

Dadeli felt somewhat guilty. He never meant to hurt anyone but ended up doing so. This steeled him a bit though, he would try to help her and hope it that she would forgive him for what he did.

What happens next?
13522111221122111.title: The storm lifts after a while and they head out.

135221112211221111.content:
"Hold there!" Someone shouted. At both their right and left, were a platoon of Thalmor troops. More rushed in behind and in front. One walked out of the group and said, "Just give up. You're wanted for crimes against the Aldmeri Dominion for crimes against the Aldmeri Dominion. Turn yourself and your friend over now, and it will be a lot less painful for the two of you. You may be one of the best warriors in Tamriel, but you are clearly outmatched."

"Just do as he says, Dadeli," Claire began, talking quietly. She removed her helmet."We may be strong, but we're no match for these guys, even if they're just Thalmor."

"That's a good girl," the Thalmor officer said before punching her in the face, knocking her unconscious. "Now, take care of the Khajiit." Dadeli felt something clobber him on the back of his head, before everything went dark.
135221112211221111.title: They find Thalmor

1352211122112211111.content:
Dadeli awoke from his sleep shackled by his wrists to a wall. He looked down and saw he was only in a loincloth. Dadeli ignored the initial embarrassment and looked around. He saw Claire who was still unconscious across from his shackled similarly. He then saw a chest in the corner of the room, probably holding their gear. He was then approached by a Thalmor Justicar. "Speak."

Dadeli smirked, "I could speak of many things to you. What would you like to hear?"

Obviously not amused, the Justicar drove a sharp tool of somekind into his chest as Dadeli yelled through clenched teeth. "How about what you and your friend were doing out there!"

Dadeli grinned, after seeing the keys on the guy's belt. He could get out of this. "Fine. Lean closer though."

Surprisingly he did as Dadeli pulled his free foot over, around his neck, and snapped his neck. Dadeli used his other toe to hook the key's chain and work it up to his hand as he undid the shackles. Before he got his gear, he ran over to Claire who began to wake up. Dadeli unshackled her and held her over his shoulder as he went toward their armor and weapons.

What happens next?
1352211122112211111.title: In a Thalmor prison.

13522111221122111111.content: "Glad I brought you along," Claire said as she began equipping her armor. "Who knows how long they'd have kept me in here, shackled to that wall, almost naked? I hate not having armor or clothes on, I tell you."
13522111221122111111.title: Rearming

135221112211221111111.content:
Dadeli placed his garbs on and was by the door with his Crossbow on his side next to his knapsack. "There's too many out there, we'll be spotted instantly. We need to get out and run." He turned and backed away from the door as Claire looked at him. "Claire?"

"What?"

"Hold on."

He grabbed her arms, wrapped them around his neck as even more fur that was much darker grew and his snout elongated. Dadeli roared and burst through the door. He charged at the Thalmor outside, mauling two of them with his claws and clamping his jaws on one's torso completely and tossing him. He roared again as a few fled but arrows began digging into his fur. Dadeli ran in a dead sprint as Claire took out a remaining few they passed by and ran into an oncoming sand storm.

They found another cave that was almost buried under sand as Dadeli managed into the space and fell into the cave. He returned to normal with Claire on his back, arrows sticking out of his arms, back, chest, and legs. He turned his head an smiled as blood dripped from his temple. "U-Unless you w-wanna stay on...you c-can get off now..." Dadeli stammered.

What happens next?
135221112211221111111.title: Dadeli comments.

choices: Dadeli wants to ask her something.
1352211122112211111111.content:
"That wasn't the first time I was captured, you know," Claire said. "Usually they keep me in there for some amount of time and try to beat some information out of me. One even tried to ask for a sexual favor, in exchange for the truth."

"What'd you do?" Dadeli asked.

"I bit his nose off and spit it out into his face," Claire said. "After they gave me three mens-worth of abuse, they decided they wouldn't ever get the whatever they were looking for out of me. Perhaps that's why I have curried the favor of the generals? My stubbornness, brutality, and endurance? Anyway, we should probably get some rest. They know our faces, and now my mission may have been compromised. I may have to resort to eavesdropping via rooftop."
1352211122112211111111.title: Rest and Planning

13522111221122111111111.content:
Dadeli propped himself against a wall and began to pull the arrows out of him. "You think you could give me a hand?" He asked. Claire walked over and removed an arrow from his leg. "Thanks. I was meaning to ask...I saw you when you healed yourself and was curious of you could teach me one or two Mage spells?"

"Why?"

"Beside my Crossbow and fists, I'm pretty defenseless. Having something like Magicka would be great. So would you be willing to teach me?" Dadeli asked.

What does Claire decide?
13522111221122111111111.title: Dadeli wants to ask her something.

choices: He would like to visit the College of Winterhold eventually.
135221112211221111111111.content: "Alright, but just to warn you, I'm not really one for teaching other than with smithing, archery, and sword play," Claire began. She taught him some basics on how to concentrate magicka and some basic spells, including Heal. "If you ever leave Elsweyr, I run a mage's college up in Skyrim. So if you ever want to, just check in there. I would suggest removing the Cursed Ring, though."
135221112211221111111111.title: Yes

1352211122112211111111111.content:
"Thank you. Perhaps through my bits of Skooma hangovers and not becoming a werewolf, I will visit. And I've tried but can't get this ring off." Dadeli said as he pulled out his bedroll and another one he had brought for Claire. "We can rest now and move in the morning or travel at night. What do you want to do?"

What does Claire decide?
1352211122112211111111111.title: He would like to visit the College of Winterhol...

choices: Dadeli gives his order and he subsequently binges on alcohol.
13522111221122111111111111.content:
"We should rest," Claire said. "We travel tomorrow morning." She laid down on her bedroll and fell asleep.

------


Morning came, with rays of light poking their way into the cave.

"FUS RO DAH!" Claire Shouted, causing an explosion of sand being blown away from the cave. Dadeli woke up with a start. "The closest town from here is likely to be Meir Lynmount. We should head there, stop for refreshment, then head toward Torval, in the jungle region."

After a couple hours of travel, they arrived in Meir Lynmount. The Khajiit seemed a little less edgy than before. They stopped at the inn for refreshment.

"I'll have a horker loaf, an ale, and salmon steak," Claire told the server. "Dadeli?"
13522111221122111111111111.title: Rest

135221112211221111111111111.content:
"My Skooma." Dadeli said straight out, the Khajiit nodded but did not say a word. Claire watched the waiter return with what looked like a knapsack, dirtied and worn as the man set it down and walked off as Dadeli opened it and pulled Skooma out, downing each of them. Claire stared for a moment but turned when the Khajiit returned with her order.

-------------

Claire finished eating when she realized what Dadeli was doing. She turned and saw empty bottles of Skooma scattered around him. "You alright?" She asked.

Dadeli looked as if he was asleep when he slumped and fell into Claire who caught him. He then sounds off with a drunken chuckle and looks up at Claire, "You're....beautiful..."

Claire wasn't sure what he was doing as she stared back. "What?"

"I...think you're beautiful...I..*urp*...love you already Claire-y..." Dadeli said in a low, drunken voice as he then held one hand along side her face as his other reached around toward the bottom of her back.

Now, what do you think is Claire's reaction?
135221112211221111111111111.title: Dadeli gives his order and he subsequently bing...

1352211122112211111111111111.content:
"I appreciate the compliment," Claire began. "But..." She smacked the heel of her palm into Dadeli's head, knocking him unconscious, his snores the only thing saying he was still alive. "I don't take kindly to flirtations. Innkeeper, I'm going to need a room." She slung Dadeli over her shoulder.

"Of course, miss," the innkeeper said. "Second floor, third room on the right." Claire handed him a small bag of Septims and headed up to their assigned room. She set Dadeli down on his bed and laid down on hers, stared at the ceiling, and folded her arms behind her head as if in thought.
1352211122112211111111111111.title: Takedown

13522111221122111111111111111.content:
His head hurt like hell. Probably because he was hit in the head and had WAY too much Skooma. Dadeli groaned as he rolled his head to one side and saw Claire looking at him arms crossed. "You feeling better?"

Dadeli was gonna say something when something more....pressing came up...And luckily there was a bucket next to him. He picked it up and puked his guts out until he fell back down on the bed. "Guh....What...happened..?"

"You flirted with me. Although some of what you said was flattering, you were on my nerves quite a bit." Claire replied.

Dadeli dropped onto his back again. "Oh....S-sorry about that....I..." He stopped before he sat up and Claire helped him to standing. "Thanks....So, now..*urp*..ugh...now what do we do?"

What do they decide to do?
13522111221122111111111111111.title: Dadeli wakes up.

choices: Thalmor in the inn's main hall.
135221112211221111111111111111.content:
"We need to get to Torval as soon as we can," Claire said. "Being a port city, as well as the capital of Elsweyr, we're likely to pick up things from the Thalmor there than anywhere else in the province. Our next stop is Chasemoor."

"Well, let's get going," Dadeli said with a slight slur and splutter.
135221112211221111111111111111.title: Eavesdrop on the Thalmor

1352211122112211111111111111111.content:
Dadeli and Claire walked down the stairs but stopped when they saw three Justicars in the main hall. Claire hid around the corner with Dadeli as they watched the Thalmor. "Now what," she cursed.

Dadeli watched as he tapped her shoulder lightly. "Stay here..." He said, his voice still slurring. He waited until all three were focused on the bartender they were questioning as he crouched and snuck by a few of the tables until he was right behind one of them. He grabbed the man and tossed him into the second one as they fell to the floor. He then ducked, spun, and brought his foot up as he knocked the other Justicar out. He walked over to to the one conscious one and kicked his face, knocking him out cold. He then looked back at the bartender, "Sorry. I'd get them out of here before they wake up." He then placed a pouch of Septims on the counter and turned to Claire who was walking toward him.

"Nice work. And right after a hangover," Claire said.

"I think you mean DURING a hangover. Speaking of that..." He opened a window and puked what was left of his guts out and walked back by Claire. "Alright, you...you should lead the way." Claire nodded as they quickly left before more Thalmor showed up.

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111.title: Thalmor in the inn's main hall.

13522111221122111111111111111112.content:
As Claire and Dadeli were headed through the planes south of Chasemoor, a platoon of Aldmeri troops lept out of the tall grass.

"Halt!" Their leader exclaimed. "Looks like our intelligence was right. The Dunmer wench was headed South of Chasemoor." He was missing a good chunk of his nose. "Come to think of it, you look familiar. That's right, you were the bitch that decided to bite off my nose!"

"Yep, and you clearly still haven't found yourself a girl," Claire said. "Of course, you're probably just sleeping with every man in your platoon."
13522111221122111111111111111112.title: They're caught by Thalmor

135221112211221111111111111111121.content:
The elf pulled an Elven sword out and ran at her when a large animal pinned him to the ground, and drove his teeth into his neck. He got off after feeding on him and turned toward the platoon. "Y'know what Dadeli?" Claire asked as she pulled her two swords out. "I'm tired of running. Get 'em!"

Claire took out two approaching Justicars with two quick slashes as Dadeli chased a few down who either ran or tried to use their swords but only to be mauled. They quickly dispatched of the Thalmor so they couldn't link them to anything affiliated with the Imperial Legion. They finished as Dadeli roared and stood over the final dead few, and breathed heavily with a bit of his hangover still affecting him. He felt Claire's hand lay on his neck as she told him that they needed to get to Torval and fast now. Dadeli nodded and turned back to normal after awhile since he fed on most of the bodies.

"Follow me," Dadeli said as he led Claire to a caravan cart and jumped in the back as he helped Claire in. "I happen to know this caravan heads straight to Torval. We should be able to get there without the Thalmor spotting us." He laid and put his hands behind his head and looked at the top of the caravan.

What happens next?
135221112211221111111111111111121.title: He attacks her.

1352211122112211111111111111111211.content:
The steamy jungles surrounding the city of Torval buzzed with life. A leopard hissed at Claire and Jacob as it slowly backed away from the road. The canopy of trees opened up to reveal a city of wood built on top of a Dwarven ruin, with all sorts of tropical vegetation mixed in. After traveling some meters beyond the tree line, Claire and Dadeli dismounted the cart.

"I'll take the rooftops," Claire began. "You cover the streets."
1352211122112211111111111111111211.title: They arrive in Torval

13522111221122111111111111111112111.content:
Claire lept onto a small, Dwarven structure before taking a leap toward a rooftop. She placed one of her hands on the roof, and catapulted herself higher, with her already great momentum, committing to an air-born, forward flip.

Now, let's see if I can pick up anything, she thought.She spotted a Thalmor soldier harassing a stall manager, but he quickly left. She tracked him to a nearby group.

"Nobody's seen any sign of a Dunmer woman in black and red armor," the one that had just arrived at the group said.

"Keep looking," on of them said. "We can't allow her to slip through our fingers again."

"What of the Imperials we kidnapped last week?" One of them asked. "They show obvious resentment toward us, but show no signs of Talos worship."

"Just keep them in those cells until they finally spill the info we want," the commanding officer said. The group splintered.
13522111221122111111111111111112111.title: Claire's POV

135221112211221111111111111111121111.content:
Dadeli hid in an alley next to a Thalmor Embassy building. He then overheard the two guards out front talking.

"I hear we're getting some more men garrisoned here later," one guard said to the other.

"Good. They can help us search that Dunmer lady and her new pet down."

"Maybe we should use the recruits as cannon fodder than collect the reward after we kill the two."

The two men laughed as they returned to their post. Reinforcements? Not good. They needed to leave Elsweyr or else they could be trapped.

What happens next?
135221112211221111111111111111121111.title: Dadeli's POV.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111.content:
Dadeli quickly found his way to the roof and jumped across them until he was on the same rooftop as Claire. "Dadeli! What are you doing up here?" Claire asked.

"I just heard a few Justicars talking. There're reinforcements on the way. If we're gonna make it, we need to leave now." Dadeli warned her.

Claire nodded as the two jumped from the rooftops. "Where to?" Dadeli asked.

Claire thought for a moment before replying, "You want to see the College of Winterhold right?"

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111.title: Dadeli warns Claire

13522111221122111111111111111112111111.content:
Claire conjured a spectral, skeletal horse with a purple, flaming mane and tail.

"Get on!" She exclaimed quietly to Dedali. He got on the horse, and Claire kicked Arvak's sides to get him to sprint toward the north road. After several hours of riding, they arrived at Cyrodiil's south gate.
13522111221122111111111111111112111111.title: Travel to Skyrim

135221112211221111111111111111121111111.content:
They passed through the south gate of Cyrodil and soon began to rode through town.

What do they decide to do?
135221112211221111111111111111121111111.title: Into Cyrodiil.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire and Dadeli soon dismounted and went toward the prison nearby. They passed by one or two cells with a few empty and a few holding convicts inside. Claire approached the officer that seemed to be commanding the area and bowed her head as did Dadeli. "Claire Delgreind, reporting with information on Thalmor movements in Elsweyr."

"Report."

"The Thalmor are garrisoning troops there and are trying to control the entire region."

The officer was silent for a few moments and lifted his head and nodded. "Very well. Good job. Is that all?"

"Yes sir," Dadeli finally spoke.

"Very well. You can get going."

The two left the Legion offices and mounted Arvak again as they went north, traveling to Skyrim.

Where do they go?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Continue to Skyrim

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
After hours of traveling north, Claire and Dadeli arrived at the town of Winterhold, with the College and Sea of Ghosts in the background.

"I was actually expecting Winterhold to be bigger," Dadeli said.

"Well, when most of a city collapses into the Sea of Ghosts, and the College is the only thing left standing, people tend to keep away from the place. And, believe it or not, this place used to be full of dark elves, but they got ousted after the Great Collapse," Claire explained as they walked through the town.

"Damn Grayskin!" Someone exclaimed. "If it weren't for your lot, Winterhold would still be a great city! Now go back where you came from!"

"And just what makes you think Dunmer are to blame for the Great Collapse?" Claire asked. "Is it because you're a Nord who wants to place blame on magic users, elves in particular? Or is it because of something else?"

"That's none o' yer damn business!" The Nord exclaimed, looking like he wanted to fight. "And you can take yer cat with you! Now get goin'!" When he saw neither of them were moving, he made a swing with his fist at Claire.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: College of Winterhold

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
It was a clean hit across the jaw that caused Claire to fall to the ground. Immediately, Dadeli placed his hand on the man's shoulder. "Listen, friend..." Dadeli then proceeded to knee the man in the gut and picked up by the neck and threw him to the ground. "....Us "cats" prefer Khajiit. And most of all keep your hands off my friend's." The man appeared to be unconscious as Dadeli turned and held a hand to Claire. "You alright, Claire?"

"Yeah, I'll be fine. Thanks," Claire said.

"Don't tell me I was like that drunk."

"You were the exact opposite. You wouldn't be able to make fist when you're drunk."

Dadeli chuckled. "You should lead the way, Arch-Mage Delgreind."

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He strikes her.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire led him across the stone bridge that connected the College to what was left of Winterhold. When they reached the portion of the bridge where it had collapsed on both sides, Dadeli couldn't help but look down.

"Watch your step," Claire said. "It's a long way down from here." After some more walking, they entered through the front gate. Faralda was waiting there.

"Good day, Arch Mage," Faralda said. "Have you brought us a new student?"

"In a way, yes. If you and the others can provide some training for him, that would be appreciated. I'm going to go up to my quarters and get some rest. If only you knew just how tiring losing the Thalmor was..."

"You're wanted by the Thalmor? As if Ancano weren't enough, now we might have an army at our door."

"Now now, Faralda," Claire said. "I really am exhausted, and I wouldn't be much use in a fight right now." She walked off toward the main door and to the Arch Mage's quarters.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: College tour/training

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli turned back to Faralda. "So, any forms of Magic you've been thinking of studying here?" Faralda asked.

"I'd like to learn more. But now, I just need to know Illusion, Destruction, and maybe some Alteration."

"You're in luck. I happen to be the expert of Destruction magic here. Tolfdir, one of our more esteemed scholars can teach you Alteration. And Drevis can teach you Illusion. Here," Faralda said as she handed him three tomes and a robe with a hood. "These are College uniforms, you can wear them if you wish. These tomes will help you learn some more high level spells. Now if you'll excuse me..." Faralda then left as Dadeli entered the Hall of Countenance.

He opened the door and found Drevis, who was shocked to see that Dadeli could see him. After A LOT of training, Dadeli learned a few tricks, such as Invisibility, Rage, Calm, and rout. Then Dadeli found Tolfdir, who taught him skills such as Stoneflesh and Muffle. Dadeli was looking around a bit more when he heard someone around a spot in the College trying to cast spells. It looked like a female Dunmer to him. "Excuse me?" Dadeli asked.

The elf looked up from her book, "Oh. You're the new student right? I'm Brelyna Maryon."

"Dadeli. Listen, I was having trouble casting a few of my spells. You think you could help me?"

"Sure. But in exchange, you get to help me." Brelyna said.

"Alright. I'm trying paralysis out but can seem to know if it works. Would you be willing to help?" Dadeli asked.

"Go ahead," Brelyna said. Immediately Dadeli readied Paralysis when Brelyna saw how he held the spell. If he casted it now, it would- "Dadeli wait!"

Before she finished, Dadeli cast the spell and Paralyzed himself. He fell into the snow in his pose as Brelyna chuckled. "You held it wrong. Here."

After getting Dadeli up an using the spell on Brelyna and it worked. Brelyna casted her spells. Due to her facial expressions, he guessed he wasn't suppose to become a horse....and a dog....and a cow. "Sorry," Brelyna kept saying before finally turning Dadeli to normal.

"I think that's enough training now. Thank you Brelyna."

"Of course."

Dadeli then decided to...
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Training first.

choices: Claire wakes up and searches for him
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli went toward one of the rooms he was given android in the bed tired. Moments later he fell to sleep.

----------

Dadeli awoke in a cold sweat and sat up from his bed. His body was shaking and he burning up. "O-oh....oh no..." He stood and stumble out of the doors, not waking anyone as he made it out of the college, across the bridge and out of Winterhold. He got a little ways out of sight of Winterhold when he fell and his robes began to tear off. His body grew black fur and his muscles contorted. He let out a roar, wanting to hunt, but something stopped him, and he instead began running farther into the snowy land.

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: ...sleep.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire awoke to the sound of howling, echoing through the stone chamber. She quickly, though begrudgingly got out of her warm bed to walk over to her armor, which was on a nearby mannequin. She hurriedly unfastened the armor, and slipped on the boots. She then equipped the leggings and breastplate. The door connecting directly to the Hall of The Elements swung open, revealing it was Tolfdir who had barged in unannounced.

"Arch Mage! Arch-" Tolfdir cut himself off when he realized he had barged in on Claire when she was only halfway dressed. His face turned red from embarrassment. "Forgive me." He walked over to an area where he couldn't see her, out of respect. "One of the new students, Dadeli, I believe, has turned up missing. We all heard howling, and I did some brief scrying. What turned up was a werewolf headed toward Journeyman's Nook."

"I know the place," Claire began. "A few miles due south of here. I should head out immediately." The clanking of metal stopped, and Claire walked out in full armor, with a dragonbone sword on her left hip, and another on her back. Her helmet was in her right hand.

As soon as Claire left the room, Tolfdir took a seat next to the enchanting table and muttered to himself, "I hope she doesn't think me a perverted, old fool."
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire wakes up and searches for him

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire mounted Arvak and rode him out of town and south off the road. She rode until she saw the small abandoned nook. She got off Arvak and walked toward the entrance to see fresh blood pooled up there. She looked up and saw in the center blood streaks leading to the corpse Dadeli was currently feeding on. He turned and saw Claire and let out a growl as he turned toward her and moved slowly. "Dadeli. Stop this, I don't want to hurt you." Claire said. She remembered the first fight they had, the damage they both dealt to each other.

"Come on. Even though you can't control the changes, you can control the beast. Snap out of it, Dadeli!"

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire tracks down Dadeli.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire watched as the werewolf stopped and began trembling, almost. It let out a whimper and tried to run when he felt his body return to his original state.

---------

Dadeli hit the snow hard. He had torn through his robes when he transformed and now had only a loincloth. Dadeli felt like he was in one of his Skooma hangovers, only worse. He could go for Skooma about now. He tried to stand but as soon as he got to his feet, he hit one of the stone walls, spun, then received a mouthful of snow. Dadeli didn't try moving again. His fur wasn't keeping him warm and the lack of clothes didn't help. He just laid there as the ice cold wind blew against him. What happened to Dadeli was a little blurry to him. He just laid there shivering and cold when he heard footsteps.

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli snaps out of it

choices: He falls asleep on her shoulder.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: "You really should get the curse on that ring removed," Claire said as she slung Dadeli over her shoulder, careful to not let the pauldron impale him. "Any idea how to do that?"
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire helps him

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
She waited for a response, but only heard Dadeli's heavy breathing lighten as he fell asleep. Claire had a choice now: Return to Winterhold and make up an excuse for the werewolf and Dadeli, or leave.

What does she decide?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He falls asleep on her shoulder.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: I should probably head to Solitude, Claire thought. She summoned Arvak, tossed Dadeli at the base of the steed's neck, mounted, and kicked him to a full sprint toward Solitude.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Leave

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli woke up to his body shaking up and down. He felt no clothing still as he saw the ground pass him by. He then felt the horse stop as his body was grabbed and held as the world remained blurry about him. He saw the sun disappear as he was pulled into some dark and dank place. He felt his body lay against something hard as his vision cleared. He saw Claire kneeling beside him and another woman with glowing eyes.

"Gugh....w-what...?" Dadeli stammered.

"Dadeli. Listen. This is Serana. She's a special kind of vampire." Claire said.

Serana stepped forward. "Claire told me what happened. You'll become a Vampire, but you'll lose Lycanthropy. If you want, I'll bite you to get rid of it."

"I'll let you decide," Claire said.

What does he decide?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Interuption.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire stood and walke back to the horse as Serana knelt beside Dadeli. "Alright. Hold still."

Serana pushed her fangs into Dadeli's neck as Dadeli blacked out.

------------

Dadeli woke up with a frozen body. He sat up, only in ragged pants and saw Claire at the mouth of the cave. She hasn't seen him, and Dadeli's instinct was to...
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Become a Vampire Lord

choices: It connects, and Dadeli falls unconcsious.
He catches her leg, and she falls to the ground.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli sprang to his feet and lunged at Claire, but he found something up against his forehead. It was a hand connected to an unwavering arm, which was connected to Claire.

"I don't see how that helped, but at least he'll stop turning into a werewolf at random," Claire said. She shoved him back and gave him a round-house kick to knock him out.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: ...bite her.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli felt something strong and heavy slam against his face as his head met stone and he lost vision.

-----------

He opened his eyes and felt like seven kinds of hell. 'What happened,' he thought as he turned his head and saw Claire standing there. She...
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: It connects, and Dadeli falls unconcsious.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: With heightened senses, Dadeli catches her leg and pushes her to the ground. Dadeli pins her down with his weight and...
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He catches her leg, and she falls to the ground.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli was suddenly thrown off of Claire, and his chest hurt. He turned toward her again, and she was charging a two-handed flame spell, and had a flame cloak on.

"We can do this one of two ways, Dadeli!" Claire exclaimed. "Vampires are weak to both the sun and fire. Right now, I've got Fire Storm charged, so if you come after me again, I'll blow you into Oblivion! Make your choice!"
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: ...is kicked off.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli was driven to blood. He ran at Claire and tackled her as she cast fire storm. Dadeli's vision went dark and he lost consciousness.

---------

When Dadeli awoke, he was...
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He attacks her again.

choices: He drags her into the cave where he met Serana.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: Dadeli awoke to his whole body burning worse than it ever had in his whole life. His fur was singed bad, and he felt like he'd been over a giant's fire. He sat up, and realized a fair amount of snow was sticking to what fur he had left, and it was still snowing. He looked over to his right and saw Claire on her back, unconscious and covered in almost two inches of snow.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: ....laying next to Claire, unconscious.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: He got to his knees as Dadeli turned his head and saw the cave they were in before. He grabbed Claire and dragged her farther into the cave. He saw a light in the cave and went to investigate it. He soon found a large cavern with animals and foliage around him with a small pond and light from the ceiling. He dragged Claire to the water, washed and dressed her wounds. He left a healing potion, turned and left, he went toward the mouth of the cave and sat, waiting for Claire to wake up.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He drags her into the cave where he met Serana.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire felt cold when her eyes fluttered open. She felt singe marks as she sat up. She looked over herself and saw bandage marks and such. She then felt her tongue hit something, something sharp. She opened her mouth and felt fangs with her fingers. Blood came from her tongue, which was, moderately soothing to her. She saw the health potion and drank then looked around the huge cavern. She remembered Dadeli attacking her and then she casted Fire Storm when she was tackled. Did he bite her then? She sighed and stood as she found her way out of the cavern to the mouth of the cave.

She stood a little ways behind Dadeli, who was sitting at the mouth of the cave, staring off. Dadeli doesn't notice Claire there yet. Claire, though, is....
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire wakes up

choices: He tries to reason with her.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: "You!" Claire exclaimed, furious as ever. "You turned me into a vampire, after I went through hell and back to cure myself of Lycanthropy!?" Tears were welling up in her eyes, just as fury was overflowing in her soul. "I can never forgive you for this! Now, get out of my sight!"
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: ...furious.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli turned and stood. He looked Claire in the eyes, "I'm sorry. If you don't want to forgive me. You don't have to. I caused you so much pain. And I'm sorry. I hope it's enough, but....If it isn't...." Dadeli then held his Crossbow out and dropped it on the ground in front of Claire at her feet. He dropped to his knees and stared at the floor.

What does Claire do?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He tries to reason with her.

choices: He still tries to reason with her.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire picked up the crossbow, but instead of loading in a bolt, clobbered Dadeli over the head with it.

"Do you know just how much gold in potions I used to prevent Sanguinarie Vampiris from reaching this state!? Of course you don't! After ridding myself of Lycanthropy, I didn't want to know what becoming a vampire would have been like. There is no known cure for vampirism, and do you know what will happen if I don't feed? I will weaken, to the point where I'm on the brink of death, and then if anything harmful were to come my way, I wouldn't stand a chance. Now get away from me, cat!"
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Hurt/Wound him

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
"Heh...You should go. You have the Legion to go to. Me....I have nothing. Either leave or do something, please, Claire...." Dadeli asked, his voice shaking.

What does Claire do?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He still tries to reason with her.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire balled her right hand into a fist and punched Dadeli in his forehead, knocking him unconscious.

"As I am now," Claire muttered. "I have nothing left." She trudged off through the deep snow, leaving Dadeli to freeze.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire knocks Dadeli out

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli woke up with his hands shackled and stretched to his sides as he sat in a tent. There was a Forsworn Briarheart in front of his as another soon came in, and stabbed Dadeli's arm. "We know you're from that Volkihar place. Get us in!"

"What? I-I'm not..." He began when the sword sliced his chest. "Keep at it until he tells us."
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli wakes up.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Hours of torture followed by Dadeli's continuous claims of how he knew nothing about Castle Volkihar fell on deaf ears as the Forsworn kept battering and bruising him.

"I don't think he knows anything," one of the Forsworn said.

"He knows something, why else would he smell of those vampires?" The Briarheart asked.

"You've been torturing him for hours, now, and he's in really bad shape. Everybody has their breaking point, and if they don't change their story, they're likely telling the truth. But whether or not you want to let him go is your decision," the Forsworn said as he walked away.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Other

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
"Fine. Take him away, but keep him far away from here." With no healing, they dragged him into a Dwarven ruin in the mountains and was left. Dadeli couldn't move, but was alive.

What happens?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Let him go.

choices: Dadeli lays there, in a crumpled heap.
He tries to converse with the woman.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: There was the sound of weapons colliding with armor, screams of pain, and death, with the finale of one Forsworn getting the life sucked out of him. The door opened, revealing a woman in full Daedric armor, who promptly kicked Dadeli aside, and headed into the Dwemer ruin.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire finds him

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dandelions laid crumpled as the figure kicked him. He recognized the figure and tried to do something. He reached his hand out and stuttered something unintelligible and laid there, the sun sapping his energy.

Did Claire notice Dadeli move?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli lays there, in a crumpled heap.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: "Look at the Forsworn whose blood I drank," Claire said, her armor protecting her from the sun's effects. "Do you see what you have turned me into? The monster that I have become? The very thing I never wanted to be?" She walked off into the wilderness without another word, Dadeli reached his hand out for her, but she paid him no heed.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Yes

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli felt if she left, he would finally lose everything. With what was left, he yelled, "C-Claaire....!"

Does Claire mind?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli calls to her.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: Claire simply walked off, pretending to not hear him. It pained her to to leave him to whatever fate awaited him, but the sun was beginning to set. She headed off, as if wandering aimlessly, with nowhere to go.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: No

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli needed...no, he wanted blood. And in an instant, he would have it. His body ebegan to change. His fur retracted, his skin pale, and his facial features changed. Wings burst from his back as he roared and flew at Claire.

He was truly a monster.

(Note: Dadeli isn't in control. He didn't want to attack Claire)
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Option 1

choices: He goes off somewhere else in search of food.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire simply spun on her heel and punched Dadeli in the face. He fell to the ground with a whimper.

"You haven't fed yet," she said. "You are weak. From now on, control yourself, and think twice about who you attack! If I see you trying to attack me from now on, I will not hesitate to kill you."
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Fight with Claire

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli turned back, laying broken. He couldn't see Claire, but stopped and spoke. "C....In m-my....pouch...t-take..."

Claire kneeled down and tore the pouch away and pulled out a large blue potion vial. "It's...f-for you...Cl-laire..."

Does she drink it?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli turns back.

choices: He puts it back in his knap-sack.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: "You need it more than I do," Claire said as she set the potion down, next to him. "You lack the ability to control transformations of any kind, so you must have it." She left a Potion of Ultimate Well-Being next to the potion to cure vampirism. She then cast Invisibility and slinked off. He grabbed the Well-Being potion's vial, uncorked and downed it. He felt like his old self again. He then turned to the vampirism potion.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: No

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
He put the potion in his knapsack and chase after Claire. He got it for Claire, to help her, he intends to.

Where is Claire?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He puts it back in his knap-sack.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire stood at the water's edge for a moment before walking into the Pilgrim's Trench, her body going deeper with each step. She disappeared and began swimming toward the wreckage below. It took about a minute, but she finally sat herself down surrounded by ship debris, and began meditation.

--------

Dadeli was able to track her after awhile. He reached the same place Claire was and pulled out a potion of waterbreathing. He dove under and swam toward the destroyed ships.

Is Claire still "alive"?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: By the water

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: Claire sat cross-legged, slightly hunched over in the bow of a wrecked ship. Dadeli grabbed her by her shoulders, and found her to be limp. He didn't have much time left on his potion, so he had to make this fast. He quickly exited the ship's hull, with Claire in tow. After almost half a minute of the potion wearing off, Dadeli's lungs felt like they would burst. He finally broke the surface of the water, and took a breath. He then started towing Claire to shore. When they were both on the beach head, he removed Claire's helmet and found, after a few seconds, that there was no pulse, or breath.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: No

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli cursed himself under his breath. There was nothing more he could do besides giving her a burial. He traveled to Labyrinthian and began to bury her right outside the tomb with the Dragon Priests' masks.

Does Claire awaken during the burial?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He goes to bury her.

choices: Dadeli forgives her, and offers her the potion.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
When Claire awoke, all was darkness, and she noticed her hands were folded on top of her chest, with one of her swords out of its sheathe, its hilt in her hands. She heard what sounded like dirt impacting the roof of her containment. She carefully slid her sword into the sheathe at her hip, and charged the Fire Storm spell. When she released it, daylight poured into her eyes, and she climbed out, seeing Dadeli had scrambled back.

"I... I thought you were dead!" Dadeli exclaimed.

"I guess you could say I was in a deep slumber," Claire began. "When I was asleep, I dreamed of everyone I had ever come across. Bandits I slaughtered and dragons I had slain. The first two were my surrogate father and mother. The next was the troops of the Imperial Legion, and I remembered how I aspired to be like them. The next was when I was in my late-teens. I caught a high-elven boy about my age observing me through the bushes, but I didn't know that years later, that same boy would ultimately save my life. I remember feeling something different about him whenever I looked into his eyes. I felt what he felt. Sorrow, anger, regret, and what surprised me most- love. After that was my time in Skyrim, and the last person I had met was you, but I hadn't felt your spirit long enough to know what you're like. I just want to say that I forgive you for turning me into a monster, but I can't forgive myself for all those I had failed. Failed to protect."
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Yes

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli stood to his feet again as he walked forward. "I forgive you too Claire....Here," Dadeli said as he handed forward the same potion. "This will cure you, but you must drink it all."

Does Claire take the cure?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli forgives her, and offers her the potion.

choices: It turned out to be a poison.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: "Again with the potion," Claire sighed. "Alright. Cheers." She downed the potion, and felt a little strange.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Yes

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
She felt her small, nagging, lust for blood disappear as her fangs vanished and the light from her eyes faded. She felt completely different after being cured. "There...I hope I helped you out for once...." Dadeli said.

What does Dadeli plan to do?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: She's not a vampire anymore.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Claire noticed Dadeli's melancholy tone. "What's happening, Dadeli?"

Dadeli paced over to something and pulled a coffin out from a weak part of the structure. "I want you to bury me. I can't...I don't want to hurt you again. Since you're not being buried there anymore, would you bury me?"

Claire nodded. Dadeli laid on his back in the coffin, as Claire stood above him. "If I see you when I get out...you should try some Skooma with me..." Dadeli grinned. Claire smirked right after she closed the lid. She then placed the coffin inside the hole he had dug and covered it back up, looked back down, saying "Thank you," turned and left.

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Lock himself away

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
"Dadeli, what- what is this!?" Claire asked, feeling weak, starting to panic. Her whole body shook, and it wasn't long before she couldn't even use her arms to support her. She was weak.

"Claire!" Dadeli exclaimed. Though, his voice A feeling of helplessness swept over her as the world faded into darkness. Dadeli heard some light, triumphant chuckling from behind him.

"I knew that Khajiit was too stupid to notice!" A voice exclaimed. Dadeli whipped around, and a group of bandits was surrounding him.

"Lights out, cat!" The chief exclaimed as he punched Dadeli square in the face.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: It turned out to be a poison.

choices: ...the two were tied up in a bandit camp.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: Dadeli had a few thoughts passing through his mind as he fell. How did they swap the potion out? Why did they attack them? Dadeli felt cold as he hit the ground, hoping the poison wasn't lethal. When he awoke...
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli POV/dream

choices: She notices Dadeli next to her.
There's some commotion amongst the bandits.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
"Hey!" A male voice exclaimed, though not loud enough to call a lot of attention. "Anybody in there? Wake up!"

Claire opened her eyes to see a young Altmer, about her age- maybe a little older, kneeling down.

"Allinor? Where... where am I?" Claire asked, slightly disoriented. She sat up and looked around. A hedge of tightly wrapped wisteria and mandevilla vines encroached nearby fencing, accompanied by red and yellow dahlia bushes and creeping, blue day plants almost completely encircled them.

"We're in Cheydinhal. I think you may have had a bit to drink. Come on! The party's right this way!" Allinor exclaimed, running off. Claire hurried to try and keep up with him, and paused when she heard cheering.

Did we win a war or something? Claire thought. She looked forward, and could see people celebrating. There was more mirth per square foot than she had ever experienced. Imperials and even some Nords splitting kegs of mead with elves, mostly Dunmer.

"Well, are you a pretty lady!" A man exclaimed. Claire looked over to her right to see an Imperial approaching her, and it was clear he was heading into his later years, and obviously full of liquid courage.

"Go back to drinking your mead, old man," Claire said sternly, trying to get the point across she was nowhere near interested in him.

"You're a farm girl, right? Whadda ya say you come to my place for a night?" The old man asked, still trying to flatter her.

"Listen here, old fool," Claire began. "I'm only going to say this once. I'm not interested in 'spending the night', and unless you want to be castrated, I suggest you leave me alone."

"Alright, fine! You weren't that pretty, anyhow!" The old man exclaimed under his breath.

"Hey! Claire! Over here!" Allinor shouted, waving to get her attention. She quickly headed over to him, the old pervert staring at her the whole way.

"What is it?" She asked.

"Take a drink of this," Allinor requested, holding a tankard of drink out for her to take.

"Well, alright..." Claire said, as she hesitantly took the tankard and took a drink of it. It tasted normal, like ale, but after a few seconds, she felt an intense burning sensation throughout her body. The pain was so great, she could only scream silently, and all was black. When she came to, she was chained to a wall in a dungeon.

"Wait until those elves get here! They promised a huge gold reward for whosoever captured that little pest of theirs alive!"

Claire felt around. Her skin was warm, and the wall cold.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Inside Claire's mind.

choices: One of the bandits speak up
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
At her side was Dadeli, who was much worse for wear. Not only was he stripped to a loincloth, but gagged and bloody. It looked as though they were/are torturing him for information.

Dadeli looked to Claire with defeat in his eyes. He tried to apologize, tried to tell her that he didn't know it was a poison, but he let out an unintelligible gurgle of blood in his throat.

What happens next?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: She notices Dadeli next to her.

choices: The elves show up to collect her and Dadeli.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: "Dadeli, we're going to get out of this, somehow," Claire said. She felt her bonds. They had been reinforced recently. She poured all her strength into trying to pull the shackled out of the ancient wall, and after a while, began noticing once small cracks become larger.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire speaks up

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: Dadeli watched as Claire managed to break away from the chains, not drawing bandit attention. Dadeli looked at Claire, giving her two options: Get him down and sneak out, or massacre the bandits and then escape.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: She breaks free.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
"The fools left our gear in this room. Typical of bandits looking for bounty money," Claire began, casting Grand Healing. Many of Dadeli's wounds disappeared, and he noticed she no longer had glowing eyes or fangs. She hurriedly equipped her armor and weapons, and made sure she wasn't missing anything. "I'll be right back, Dadeli. You're too weak to fight right now. And while it may be unlikely, maybe I'll be able to find something to cure your vampirism. Make you strong again."

"A prisoner's loose!" A bandit exclaimed as he charged Claire with a warhammer. He swung the weapon at her, and found his hands to be bleeding, with his arms suffering from recoil and shock. He looked up to find that she had caught his warhammer by the head with only one hand, and it spontaneously shattered, with her hand clenching shut. Acting out of fear, the bandit quickly turned and ran, screaming for help. A marauder charged Claire with a greatsword, but swiftly found his legs and arms dismembered, Claire's legs around his neck, and himself being hurled into his comrades.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Fight out

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Dadeli, though his wounds were gone on the surface, could barely pay attention to the fight. He could make out one thing though...

...Claire was winning.

Dadeli saw marauders, a few chiefs and A LOT of bandits attack Claire, only to be chopped up, having blood spilled, and being killed. Dadeli soon let his head hang as the fight died down and ended with Claire winning. He felt his wrists unshackle as he fell for a second and was caught by Claire, who left and brought him...
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: More fighting.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
Upon exiting the bandit's hide-out, Dadeli watched as the world around him went dark. After what felt like a few seconds, he awoke on a straw mattress next to a small fire. He didn't recognize his surroundings. Cobblestone floor, brick walls, and wooden doors that had been painted red, with wrought-iron handles.

"I don't like the fact that you've got a Volkihar vampire in here," a woman said.

"Relax Jordis," another woman assured the other. Her voice sounded familiar. "He hasn't fed once since he was afflicted. I could cast Flames and he'd be dead in seconds if he turned." There was a knock at the door upstairs. A man was speaking with the women. He had a gruff voice, kind of like that of a grizzled military veteran.

"The Aldmeri Dominion has had a bounty on your head for a while, since you crashed Elenwen's party, on the behalf of the Blades. What was once a simple five hundred gold bounty is now a fifty thousand gold bounty. Keep on your toes, Legate. I have a feeling you're going to find out who your friends really are."

"Yes, General Tullius," Claire, Dadeli assumed, said.

"You're my most esteemed, irreplaceable officer. I can't afford to lose you at the hands of the Dominion, as this war could continue to drag on, benefiting the Thalmor. Eventually, the Emperor will probably have me called back and stationed in Cyrodiil to help coordinate our forces if this keeps on too long. Ulfric has no idea how truly powerful the Thalmor are. I hear he's even in with them, and is attempting to deceive Skyrim for his own gain. Therefore, 'm going to need you to do the one thing you're probably not familiar with. I need you to pick your battles wisely. One wrong move, and it could cost us the war. And Cyrodiil," Tullius finished.

"You don't need to worry about me, sir," Claire said, attempting to reassure him.

"I hope you're right. Dismissed."

"You have a bounty on your head?" Jordis asked, incredulous.

"Relax. The Thalmor are so arrogant, they think one Dunmer isn't a match for a death squad. I bet they're not even trying."
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: ...to her home.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: Dadeli managed to pull himself upright as he stood and his head spun. He wasted no time stumbling through the door and tripping on the stairs. He could hear Claire and another woman talking, but their conversation was distorted and slurred to him. He managed to get up the stairs to see the blurry image of Claire and the other. They looked at him as he opened his mouth in attempt to communicate. Judging by the look on the two's faces, what he said wasn't intelligible. He crawled forward before letting his head drop. What does Claire and Jordis do?
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Dadeli heads upstairs.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: "Stay back, Jordis," Claire began. "His delirium could me a symptom of him about to transform again. Dadeli, can you understand what I'm saying?"
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Stay back, cautiously.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content: Dadeli nodded, but continued to stumble. "I'm...I'm fine....Just...tired..." He stood up with his back to the wall. "What happened...?"
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: He can uderstand her.

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
"You accidentally gave me poison, which knocked me out. I overheard some bandits talking about handing us over to some elves for a bounty. I suspect the Thalmor may have been involved."

"Poison? How?" Dadeli asked, shocked. His vision cleared momentarily and he noticed her eyes were no longer glowing. She didn't even have fangs anymore. "How, then, did your Vampirism get cured?"

"That's a funny story, actually. I woke up on a stone patio in Cheydinhal, or so I thought. After having short conversation with an old friend, and telling a perverted old man to bugger off, said friend offered me a tankard of mead. After I drank it, I felt like I was on fire, collapsed, and woke up in the bandit's hideout. I'm sure you know the rest. Now I have a fifty thousand gold bounty on my head."

"Fifty THOUSAND!?" Dadeli exclaimed. He couldn't fathom having such a bounty on his head, as he never had much gold at any given time, but Claire was most likely loaded. There was a knock at the door, and Jordis answered.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Claire explains

1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.content:
"I've got a message for one of the Thanes of Solitude. A Miss Delgreind, I believe. I need you to give her this letter. It's from Emperor Titus Mead II. Looks like that's it. Got to go."

Jordis shut the door and handed Claire the letter.

"Oh, Dadeli," Claire began. "I found this in our captor's chief's quarters. I think it would benefit you most right now." She held a red vessel of fluid before him.
1352211122112211111111111111111211111112.title: Courier

1353.content: Where else could she possibly be?
1353.title: Somewhere else.

"Sir! Please, help us!" A desperate, terrified Thalmor mage cried out to his Commander., tripping over himself, and landing face-first in the grass, mere feet from his superior.

"What happened?"

"I... I don't know! A warrior in white armor attacked us, and cut down half of the division in minutes! Some disappeared, then reappeared dead!"

"Calm down, son! Please, calm down!"

"Father, I just," The young soldier was cut off as he felt an invisible force tug violently at him. "Please! Help me!" He cried out, being quickly dragged back into the darkness of the night. All was quiet, then the officer saw it, a woman clad in white armor, wielding a large scythe in one hand, and a spell in the other.

"You, there! Declare yourself!" The Commander shouted, raising a Glass greatsword.

The woman simply gave a chuckle, before gripping the scythe with her other hand.

"I said, declare yourself!"

"I just wanted to send a message."

"What kind of message?"

"Either leave High Rock, or pay the blood fee."

"I believe I've already payed too much."

"And if I disagree?"

"You killed my son right in front of my eyes! Give me one reason why I shouldn't cut you down where you stand!?"

"Why don't you take a look at your camp? Tell your superiors exactly what you saw."

As the mysterious woman walked away, toward Daggerfall, he Thalmor Commander ran over to the corpse of his only son, and began to weep.

"Fear not," he said, choking on his own tears. "I will either avenge you, or join you, my son. You were all I had left."
13531.title: High Rock.

choices: Split into three groups of two.
Split into two groups of three.
135311.content:
"Haha!" A large Nord shouted, nearly spilling his mead. "Full house! Hand it over!"

Groaning with disdain, three of the other four at the table slid their meager winnings into the Nord's growing pile. At the other side of the table, an Altmer rested his head on the oak hard top.

"Not that lad's game, now is it?" The Nord laughed. "I tried to get our lovely employer to stay and play, but she probably thought I was talking about a different version of this game."

"Speaking of which," a Redguard began. "I'd rather be out there fighting the Thalmor, not in here playing cards with a drunkard and a passed-out Altmer!"

"I get the feeling you'll have your day in battle soon enough, Lanssean," a woman spoke. The entire table turned toward the voice, to see a young Dunmer woman approaching the table. "More and more Thalmor troops move into High Rock almost every day, but if they want to do to the Adamantine Tower, what they tried to do to The Throat of The World, the whole world is in greater danger than you may realize."

"I don't get it," a Breton in the group spoke up. "What does the Adamantine Tower have to do with that mountain?"

"I will tell you all when I feel you are ready, Gynace. Afelius, Kirlyth, could you wake Arroril from his coma?"

"Naturally," Kirlyth responded.

"Actually, I think I know how to handle this," the Nord said, rising from his chair and crouching beside Arroril. After taking a deep breath, he let out a long, loud roar, causing the intoxicated Altmer to fall backwards and sideways out of his chair in a panic, receiving a hefty amount of laughter from half the bar's patrons.

Dizzy, dirty, and embarrassed, Arroril quickly set his seat back upright, and followed suit, himself.

"Thanks for that, Godrus," Claire said flatly.

"Any time!" Godrus replied, gleefully.

"What'd I miss?" Arroril asked, fixing his robe.

"You missed life. Oh, you should have seen it! Butterflies, blood, a severed head! But now, we're all in Sovngarde, friend!" Godrus toyed.

"Odd, Sovngarde looks just glamorous than an inn back in the Summerset Isle."

At that, Godrus couldn't help but burst into laughter.

"Don't worry, we're all still alive and in Daggerfall. I've been to Sovngarde, Arroril, and it's actually pretty spectacular."

"Okay, now that we're done with that, what's today's plan?"
135311.title: Daggerfall

14.content:
Name: Dadeli
Race: Khajiit (Werewolf)
Sex: Male
Height: 5'9 (6'5 as werewolf)
Appearance: Dadeli has yellow/blond fur with a few black and white splotches on his body. His brown hair hangs down behind his head. Wears a cloak similar to the ones worn in Hammerfell. Has a Cursed ring of Hircine and Upgraded gloves with a 100% more Unarmed damage.
Weapons: Claws, Enhanced Dwarven Crossbow.
Powers: Beast Form, Night Sight.

He traveled with a Caravan as defense for some time before he left to explore. While with the caravan, he picked up a bit of archery and sneaking tips. After leaving, he got into quite a few brawls and was able to become quite skilled in hand-to-hand combat. He even won his gloves from a man in the Ratways. He also became a skilled thief, even rivaling the Thieves Guild's best.

Where is he now?

141.content: Dadeli awoke with a headache that he could care less about as he laid sprawled across the ground right next to a lake. He looked up and saw a Redwater Skooma bottle empty in front of him. Great. He tried to get up to his knees but felt the world spin around him and he fell onto the shore in the water. He laid there as breeze from the lake blowed his fur around. 'Think I'll take a nap here...' Dadeli thought when...
141.title: In a hangover

choices: He looks up to see who it is.
1411.content: "Just another skooma addict," a woman said, flustered. "Typical."
