14111.content:
Dadeli heard a voice. To him it was warbled, and his vision blurred so he couldn't see her very well. "W-well...th-this is..*hic*...embarrassing." Dadeli stumbled a bit trying to stand as he dropped back to the ground. "Ugh...u-um...y-you th-think y-you could...?"

Does the woman help?
14111.title: He looks up to see who it is.

141111.content: "Hold on," the woman said. Dadeli heard a spell discharge for a few seconds before his head was dunked into the frigid water. "Better?"

1411112.content:
Dadeli felt his face hit the cold water. Though it seemed to calm him even more, it didn't get rid of the pain rocking through his skull. He dragged his head out and laid back on the shore. "Th-thanks...B-but th-that won't work..." Dadeli shivered. "Y-you have a-any p-potions l-lady..?"

Will she help some other way?
1411112.title: No.

14111121.content: "Yeah," the woman said, handing Dadeli a healing potion, which he immediately downed. "I know an Argonian that had a skooma problem. Gave her one of those and it fixed her right up. Feeling better yet?"
14111121.title: Yes

141111212.content:
Dadeli drank the potion down and felt wounds from whatever happened heal, but still could barely move with his light-headedness. He shook his head. "Anything else...A-anything r-really?"

Does she help AGAIN?
141111212.title: Still, no.

choices: He bring his head out of the water to get a look at the woman.
1411112121.content: "Close your eyes and open your mouth," the woman said. Dadeli did just as she said, and he almost choked from the bitter flavor, and it wasn't long before his mouth was dryer than a desert and his sinuses started to burn. He quickly dunked his head into the lake to clear the burning sensation. Because his ears were still above water, he heard someone snickering.
1411112121.title: Yep

14111121211.content:
He let his head float in the water on the back of his head. He saw a female dark elf with a smirk standing above him. "W-well...that worked..." Dadeli croaked out. He sat up and shook his fur dry. "I-I...My name's Dadeli...you?"

How does she reply?
14111121211.title: He bring his head out of the water to get a loo...

141111212111.content: "My name is Claire Delgreind. I was sent here from a nearby village because they heard some strange noises from the woods. I guess it's not anything to worry about."

Does she let him?

"I think I know what you mean," Dadeli said as he equipped his Hammerfell garb. "Where to?"

"Just follow me," Claire said as she began walking. Dadeli stood and followed. They traveled through the forest for awhile when Dadeli felt lightheaded. He knew what that meant.

"Claire!"

"What?" Claire said back.

"Y-you need to stay back, okay? Just...ngh!..." Dadeli said before his body become deformed and standing before Claire was a large black werewolf. It let out a low growl and looked toward Claire.

What does she do?

14111121211111222.content:
Dadeli felt something strike his chest. The arrow hurt, but it wasn't going to stop him. He felt though, that he knew her, almost recently. He ignored that and lunged forward with his jaw open, trying to clamp tight on her.

Does he catch her
14111121211111222.title: He's even more pissed off.

choices: He gets back up and charges again.
141111212111112222.content: Claire ducked, put her hands on Dadelli's ribs and gut, and tossed him off of her. Dadelli lost his balance, and went tumbling into a tree.
141111212111112222.title: No, she dodges it.

He felt wood splinter against his back as his vision jolted. Dadeli couldn't remember what happened, but figured it out when he saw his hand a large black claw. 141111212111112222111211.content:
"Alright, missy," a bandit in steel plate armor began. "First, I'm going to teach you a little lesson about coming into Skyrim. This place belongs to the Nords! And we're not going to let some Dunmer bitch take it from us!" He drove a red-hot tool into her shoulder. It looked similar to what was used during burial preparations.

"Hey, don't be too rough! Some of us want a piece of her, too! If you catch my meaning," a bandit called out.

"Shut up! I can't believe you would want to do that to such an inferior and disgusting-"

"...RO DAH!" Claire Shouted, sending the Bandit Leader flying across the room.

"See? Not so inferior after all, is she? We'll let you torture and kill her after we sell off her armor and weapons, and have our way with her."

"Fine. By the way, how's the quality of what she had?"

"Well, it's a lot better quality than anything I've ever seen! You could buy a good-sized house for the value of this stuff. Not to mention, we found about a quarter million Septims, and several thousand Septims in jewels and jewelry. The girl's a walking armory, I tell you."

"I knew this one was going to be worth the trouble! It's a big pay day for all of us! I get twenty. Remember that. Oh, and find a buyer! It's not like we can just go walking into town!"

This could be difficult, Dadeli thought.

"Get them, now!" Someone shouted. Within seconds, there were half a dozen guys in chitin armor on Claire, and twice as many on Dadeli. There was a dagger to her throat. "Check her back. 141111212111112222111211121111112211211.content:
Claire awoke with a jolt, and pain shot through her body.

"Easy, easy!" Someone exclaimed quietly. "You're still in pretty bad shape. Better, but not as well as you could be. You're pretty badly torn up. Do you remember who attacked you?"

"The- Morag... Tong," Claire uttered through her obvious pain. She opened one of her eyes enough to see who she was talking to. A mage in lavish robes.

"What would the Morag Tong want with you two?" The mage asked.

"I'm Brotherhood and Arch-mage of the College in Winterhold, but I haven't had a contract in weeks. Never crossed the Morag Tong in my life," Claire uttered through painful, dry heaves.

"You're the Arch-mage of Winterhold? One of my cousins goes there! But, why join the Dark Brotherhood?" He asked.

"I needed the money. And what of Dadeli- the Khajiit that was with me?" Claire asked.

"He's dead, but we're working on replacing his heart with a heartstone. He should be, shall we say, 'awake' in a few hours."

"What of our gear?"
141111212111112222111211121111112211211.title: A wizard from the House of Telvanni

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
"Don't worry," the wizard spoke. "We saw two chests nearby with your weapons and gear. Now come on. Let's see how your friend is doing."

Dadeli eyes opened to a small cave like room. His body felt wrong. He sat up in only ragged pants and felt a surge in his chest as his body convulsed. His vision went crazy as someone approached his side and held him down. "Stay still!...For the sake of-! Get over here he's waking up!" The man yelled. He saw a lavished dressed Mage run and hold him down. His head dropped as he saw Claire holding the door wall for support. He dropped his head and only muttered something unintelligible. The mage's grasp relaxed and his body stopped. "W-Wha-....h-happened...?"

What happens next?
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: We have it.

"The Khajiit died on the way here, but we successfully revived him with a heart stone. And, Miss, your ribs were completely exposed and fractured in multiple places, your flesh was torn up, and all of the bones in your limbs were fractured in multiple places. Your friend wasn't doing much better, even though he obviously wasn't exposed to anything as bad as you were." The mages walked Claire over to a platform similar to what Dadeli was on, and the cast Heal Other. Claire could feel her bones and flesh healing rapidly, and it was almost painful. Dadeli could feel his chest closing up, and the deep wounds he had following suit. After nearly half an hour of healing, they both felt like their old selves.

With her wounds healed, Claire coiled her body, and kicked out her legs, while pushing out with her arms, launching her a couple feet into the air, and she landed on her feet gracefully.

"To repay the Morag Tong. I'm going to make sure not one of them survives. Dadeli, you can either come with me or stay here, your choice. If you want to come, I'm not going to stop you," she said. "But what they did.. they just made things personal on a level they can't even imagine."

She swung cross-ways, barely missing the assassin's upper chest, before thrusting her sword into his heart. The second also swung downward with his blade, only to have it connect with Claire's sword. She rotated her blade clock-wise in a wide circle for two rotations, catapulting the assassin's sword into the air. No sooner did the assassin watching the fight draw his blade than he was impaled with his comrade's sword, which landed its blade into the top of his skull. The disarmed Morag Tong assassin fell backwards onto the ground, begging for mercy before he cast Incinerate on Claire. The spell had almost no effect on her at all. He started scrambling backwards even faster when he found himself backed against a tree and Claire's sword against his throat.

choices: She goes to get Dadeli before heading to Blacklight.
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
As Claire entered the sanctuary's main hall, all was still. On a nearby table was a note, the length of a letter. It read,

         Dreseth has been acting rather strange after giving that report about those Telvanni mages picking up the bodies of our most recent prisoners 3 days ago. After I had a short talk with him about his suffering performance, due to his most recent botched contract, he said he's had difficulty sleeping at night. Said he keeps having terrifying dreams of zombie werewolves and a spectral dragon tearing us all to shreds in a manner more violent than any of us had witnessed before. I don't understand how dreams could have such an effect on one of our top assassins, but I don't like the sound of it at all. Such highly-detailed dreams could only be a message from beyond, saying we have to get out of here, otherwise we'll end up far worse than that dark elf with the Imperial dragon tattoo. If our patrols see one of them, they're to report to me, and we're heading to our sanctuary by Blacklight to regroup with more assassins. Strength in numbers, as they say. Not sure how that will help us, considering we just got their battle records. There's not much on the Khajiit, but that ring had raised a few eyebrows, considering it couldn't be removed. The Khajiit also smelled of wet dog. The Dunmer, however, had a list longer than the amount of successful contracts for any of us.

         By Azura, I and five others have started having the same dream as Dreseth, and the others haven't been told of his night terrors! It's far more terrifying than I could have fathomed. It all felt so real- the pain, the suffering, the want to just roll over and die! Then there's that terrible dragon spirit. We should have just given that Dark Brotherhood assassin and her pet quick, merciful deaths! I can only pray they don't return here. Has this sanctuary been cursed? By those mages? Or are we being haunted? Nonsense! They're just dreams! They'll pass in time. I hope.
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Nobody; just a note.

Claire pulled out a small piece of paper. "They seemed to have fled to Blacklight. I came back to see if you want to accompany me."

Dadeli nodded. "Hell yes! You're not the only one with a grudge against them. They killed me!...Literally!"

Claire smirked a tiny bit. "Then let's get going." Claire and Dadeli got a distance away from the mages as she summoned Arvak. "How are you gonna get there Dadeli?"

Dadeli grinned as fur grew and he became a lumbering werewolf. He growled and nodded at Claire as they rode/ran off toward Blacklight.

Claire dismounted Arvaak, and Dadeli changed back to normal. When they neared the construct, Claire's suspicions were stripped of doubt, while Dadeli felt an unfamiliar presence, whose power rivaled or even surpassed Claire's. She approached the central pillar, which had the Akaviri symbols for 'Dragonborn' and 'King' on it. She placed the palm of her right hand on the pillar face, and was instantly transported to another dimension, but her body remained in Tamriel, but nor was she in soul form. All she saw around her was a thick mist. She heard someone approaching and saw someone in dragon priest robes. As she approached, the figure she saw turned out to be Miraak.

"I see you have found me once again, even though I did not make the mistake of ordering my cultists to try and dispatch of you," Miraak said.

"You- you're already dead! I absorbed your soul and saw your skeleton with my own two eyes! There's no possible way-"

"A piece of me managed to escape your ravenous soul, which I shall claim in time, and you will not be able to do a thing to stop me. Now, begone!" Miraak bellowed. Claire found herself back on Tamrielic soil and felt a great deal of pain within her. She unleashed blood-curdling screams as a result and passed out soon after. When she woke up, she found herself in...
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: ...they approached the construct.

choices: He lays her down for her to rest (Introductions)
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
As Claire's vision blurred into focus, she saw a man above her with an open white coat, pants, gloves, and long dark hair. "Good, you're awake." The figure said as he reached down and picked her up over his shoulder.

"What....Wh-where...?" Claire stammered.

"Don't worry. You're safe here. Now rest alright?" The man said as they moved farther into the cave.

Claire didn't hurt, but she felt light, woozy, and disoriented. "Who...?"

The man cleared his throat. "I'm Kresnik. Found you passed out by those weird temples being made. Now you rest up and then I'll explain. Okay?"

Claire had dozed off near the end as she hung over his shoulder like a burlap sack and moved deeper into the cave.

"So, what's your name?" Kresnik began when he found out Claire passed out again. He sighed, shook his head, and continued walking until he found a giant cavern with sunlight coming through the top and foliage growing.

Kresnik's Home.

He carried her to a wool roll he had used to sleep in and laid her inside and covered her in the blanket.

He stood and walked into the light and looked up into it. He was immune to the negativistic effects of the Sun. Blessed by Light, he was turned, and now serves for the better of others.

Kresnik sighed as he sat by Claire waiting for her to awaken.

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Claire passes out

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
Claire shot awake, sitting upright, and began to take in her surroundings. She was in a large cavern with folia and large pitfalls in the cave ceiling. She removed the blanket and got up from the bed roll, examining her surroundings some more. She found the same vampire from earlier sitting in a cloak of sunlight (no, he's not a sparkling, pretty-boy pixy with an identity crisis) on the edge of a small body of water. It resembled a tidal pool, like one of the ones Claire had seen down in the Summerset Isle when she went there on business, and the vampire wore white garbs similar to that of a Moth Priest.

"Excuse me?" Claire began.

"Hm? Ah, you're awake," Kerstik said.

"Who'd you say you were?" Claire asked. "I think I blacked out before you told me. And if you're a vampire, why aren't you hurt by the sun's light?"

"My name is Kerstik, I'm a Vampire Lord. I gave myself to the light, and as a result, the sun strengthens me. So, who are you, dark elf?" He noticed her examining the scars on his chest. "I got those from numerous battles. Say, you wouldn't happen to have some scars on your chest, would you?"

"You men are all the same! My name is Claire Delgreind. I take it you found me near that Miraak shrine? And what of the Khajiit that was with me?"
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Claire wakes up

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
"Khajiit?" Kresnik said. "I only found you there then. Out like a light. Rapid breathing. Had to do something. Was this Khajiit a friend of yours?" Kresnik asked.

Claire shook her head. "In a way, yes. His name is Dadeli."

Kresnik stood. "We can search for him. Let's get going."

As they gathered their things. Kresnik looked back over. "Hey, um...do you have markings on your chest? I thought I saw something when I was looking for wounds there, but could you confirm that?"

What happens?

"Ow!" Kresnik exclaimed. His face stung from the impact, and his right cheek felt rather sore. "That's definitely going to bruise..."

"That's just a warning!" Claire exclaimed. "The next time you go undressing me while I'm either knocked out or asleep, I'll rip your heart out with my bare hands!"
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Claire replies

Hundreds of Thalmor soldiers lined the hills to the north of where Claire and Kresnik stood, brass yellow, and turquoise glinting in the sun's midday light. A commanding officer approached them.

"I am a Thalmor Justiciar, and I am placing the two of you under arrest for interference in Thalmor affairs. Really, I'm just arresting the vampire for his association with you, and I think I'll beat answers about these shrines out of you, Dunmer bitch! And maybe I'll just break your bones because I feel like it," The Justiciar spat.
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: ...a Thalmor battalion.

Kresnik nodded as the two raise their hands. "I agree, but I don't like it." The Justicar stood in front of them and nodded toward them, but not at them. The two were then clobbered over the head and knocked unconscious, then dragged to a Thalmor torture room in a compound.

What happens next?
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Kresnik agrees.

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
Claire woke slowly, her head pounding, similar to how she felt after she woke up in the Temple of Dibella in Markarth after a drinking contest with Sanguine. After her vision cleared, she noticed she and Kresnik were stripped down to their undergarments. Claire blushed at this less-than-pleasant surprise as a Thalmor Justiciar entered the room.

"Listen, and listen well, scum," The Justiciar spat. "You have been..."

"...arrested for my crimes against the Second Aldmeri Dominion and disrupting their foreign affairs," Claire finished, exaggerating a sigh. "Got anything else to say?"

"Smart girl, but do you actually think the life of a criminal pays?"

"I think crime pays," Claire began. "The money's good, you travel a lot."

The Justiciar cut her across the stomach with a dagger. Not deep enough to cause organ damage, but enough to cause a great deal of pain and bleeding.

"You think your torture methods are painful?" Claire asked. "I nearly died at the hands of the Morag Tong, and was mutilated to the point where anyone would have thought I was beyond saving. This torture is nothing compared to the methods they employed, and do you know why they did it? They nearly killed me simply because I'm with the Dark Brotherhood."

"I don't care about the hows and whys, all I care about is getting the answers I need. So spill what you know about those shrines being built!"

"Miraak, the first dragonborn is possessing people to build those shrines for him. I thought I destroyed him. I absorbed his soul and saw his skeleton with my own eyes in Apocrepha. I don't know how he could've possibly escaped."
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Claire wakes up

choices: Claire finds a way to unshackle herself
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
"Lying Dunmer! You think I believe that! Miraak's been dead for thousands of years and has always been!" The Justicar pulled his hand back for a slap when Kresnik spoke.

"She speaks the truth. Just open your eyes!" Kresnik spoke up.

The Justicar turned to Kresnik. "Really? How about I open you up instead!" He thrusted the dagger into him and sliced him across the chest. Kresnik clenched his teeth as the man stabbed him one more time, this time leaving the dagger in him. "I'll deal with you once I finish with her." The Justicar turned and left.

Kresnik looked back at Claire, "You alright?" Claire nodded as they were left alone again.

What happens next?
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: "You lie!"

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
"You alright?" Claire asked.

"Yeah," Kresnik answered. "So, where'd you get that tattoo?"

"I didn't get it anywhere. I was born with it."

"Right. So, any idea how we're going to get out of here?"

"No idea..."
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: They converse

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
A few moments passed when two Justicars entered. They each had a wide variety of torture tools. They each got to work on the prisoners. Kresnik could hear Claire's grunts and screams as the Justicars dug into them. The pain was intense and felt like an eternity before they finished and left. Kresnik was bleeding bad, cuts and wounds that bled a dark red.

Claire looked like blood out-lining a person. Bleeding profusely with large gashes in her, she was still breathing, but unconscious and limp. The Justicar returned with a dagger and stood in front of Kresnik. "Any last words?"

Kresnik tried to speak but couldn't, as the Justicar leaned closer mockingly. At that distance, Kresnik bit into his neck, draining the life from the Justicar silently. The Justicar fell as Kresnik finally had strength to break the bind on his wrists. He equipped the Justicar's hooded robes and unshackled Claire, holding her in his arms.

Under his disguise, he packed up they're armor and fled before any noticed their absence. He struggled under the weight until he tripped and fell into some pit. It was a cave that wasn't very large. Using his old robes, he covered Claire up and laid her down gently when he collapsed beside her in a crumpled heap.

What happens next?
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: The Justiciar returns.

choices: She gets the blood off her first.
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content: Claire awoke slowly, her whole body throbbing in pain. She placed her left hand on her forehead to try and make the pain subside, before she noticed there was something slightly sticky and thick as tree sap on her hands. She opened her eyes, slowly, and her vision was flooded with a lot of stinging and red hues. Blood had gotten in her eyes, and when she looked herself over, she noticed she was covered in a thin, syrupy layer of blood, effectively turning the whole of her red. She could feel, but not see, where areas of skin were missing. There was a nearby stream a few yards behind her, and Kresnik, who was covered in blood and passed out, in front of her.
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Claire wakes up

choices: Claire washes the blood off and recovers
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
Claire stumbled around on her weak legs and shaky limbs as she fell on her knees over the Thalmor robed-clad Kresnik. She flipped him over and held him up against her knees. Kresnik slowly came to, surprised to see her up and moving. "Claire..? Y-you shouldn't be up..." Kresnik spoke, obviously tired.

"What happened?" Claire said with a dry mouth.

"I was able to get us out, but I couldn't get far. Still, we should be hidden here." Kresnik rolled over onto his knees and hands as he turned back toward Claire. "Wash the blood away...I-I'll scout out here..."

He stood sloppily and exited the cave.

What happens next?
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: She checks on Kresnik.

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content: Claire submerged herself in a deeper area of the stream, a few feet from where it dove under a cluster of rocks in the cave wall. The water flowing out was a deep pink, and the blood came off unexpectedly easy, revealing numerous cuts and abrasions. She cast Grand Healing to heal her multitude of wounds, and heard someone enter the cave. It was...
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Claire washes the blood off and recovers

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
Kresnik stumbled around a little bit before turning toward Claire. "Saw a few Th-Thalmor nearby...But it looks like they'll go the other way..." Kresnik kept moving until he suddenly collapsed on the spot.

What does Claire do?
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: ...Kresnik with news.

choices: Kresnik awakes to the smell of food.
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content: Putting on a dress she had brought with her, Claire sifted through her belongings, removing firewood and a hanging pot. After digging through her belongings some more, she found some materials she could use to make some food for them. Her hands were starting to shake from not having eaten in almost a day.
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Go help him

1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.content:
Kresnik opened his eyes slowly, blood staining his body. The smell of food in the air made his body even weaker, having not eaten. He shook, only able to lay there as he turned his head and saw a figure he assumed was Claire moving in his blurry vision. He let out a silent groan and dropped his head.

What happens next?
1411112121111122221112111211111122112112.title: Kresnik awakes to the smell of food.

1512.content: "Halt! Stop right there!" A guard yelled as him and a few others chased after the Argonian through Morthal's street. John ran toward the water. If he got it, he could swim away with loot from his latest spree. But does he make it?
1512.title: Running away from guards

choices: East, in the direction of Riften...
West, in the direction of Falkreath...
West, into Helgen. Or at least whatever that smoke in t
152.content:
Name: Eva Manulus
Race: Imperial
Sex: Female
Height: 5'9
Appearance: Piercing ice blue eyes with black hair that reaches just her shoulders and a surprisingly youthful looking face for her age which often leads many people to misjudging her actual age. Starts off mounted on a stolen horse directly south of Helgen along the road that connects to Cyrodiil.
Weapons: Imperial sword, Longbow
Powers: Longevity similiar to Mer, despite not being of any Mer descent (Though she is actually unaware of this), Imperial Luck
Best stats: One Handed, Block, Alchemy, Light Armour, Heavy Armour, Archery, Restoration.

Bio: Originally an Imperial Scout, Eva was often sent off on missions where she wouldnt be seen for weeks. She underwent basic training in Alchemy and the Restoration art of Magicka in order to further assist herself and others in the field. Eva is an excellent archer, able to launch of a volley of arrows in quick succession, each of which has amazingly precise accuracy up to about one hundred meters. Her swordsmanship skills are also formidable and she has little trouble defending herself in combat.

Eva prefers to understand people with their actions rather than with words, something which very often made it difficult to form relationships with other members of the Imperial Legion. She is very strongwilled and likes it when things get done rather than wasting time. It was these problems which caused her to strongly object to the White Gold Concordant. Finally after fifteen years, the Thalmor managed to have her forcibly ejected from the legion (Under the pretenses of not abiding by the treaty) and then attempted to assasinate her.

Now on the run, she is tired and has just passed the border into Skyrim, a place where the Thalmor's hold is not nearly half as strong as that of Skyrim's. She is completely unable to rely on the support of the legion despite her strong loyalty to them. It is time for her to create a new life and hopefully live well.

There are several options laid out for Eva. What path does she take?
152.title: Eva Manulus

choices: A farm! Somewhere to stop and rest at...
It's nothing, Eva keeps pushing forward...
1521.content:
Eva's head hurt. Badly. She was tired, having slept for short minutes in the sadle. Having been removed from the legion only a few days ago, she had been chased by Thalmor assasins right across the border. A stray arrow had cut through the skin on her upper left arm, leaving a gaping wound that she only had time to wrap a crude bandage around.

There was no time to use any healing spells on it.

There wasnt time for anything.

Barely conscious, and aware of the stolen horses own tiredness, she looked at the path in front of her. It split into two directions, one heading down to what she was certain was Helgen Keep just around the corner and the other, east, up into the mountains which a split second look at the map appeared to be the direction of Riften.

"Thieves and bunglers" She murmured to nobody in particular. At least with the right gold, none of them should rat her out to the Thalmor. Eva turned the weary horse east and headed into the mountains. It was sheer luck that she wasnt beset upon by a troll or a pack of wolves. Either of which would have easily made a meal out of her in this state.

Eventually, the snow covered ground gave way to frosted grass. But Eva barely noticed it. With what little focus she had left, she wanted to get away from any sort of danger. The difference between thirty minutes and thirty seconds quickly became a blur to her as the horse continued down the path, only the knowledge of the difference between cobblestone and mud prevented it from leaving the road and into the uncharted wilderness since Eva was now too tired to stay awake.

Whether it was a sixth sense or luck, something stirred in Eva's mind, forcing her awake. She looked to the right and was certain she could see something on the otherside of a thick bunch of trees.
1521.title: East, in the direction of Riften...

choices: Ingvild hides you in a barrel downstairs.
Quickly hide under one of the beds!
15211.content:
A farm.

Farm. That meant food, water... rest.
That last word hung in Eva's mind and she urged the horse on towards the farm. Unfortunately, Eva didnt have the energy left to actually dismount and approach the door, instead falling out of the sadle onto the dusty ground.

A nordic woman, clearly aged, had looked up as Eva entered the farming grounds. She instinctively knew that something was wrong as soon as she arrived and hurried over. She was too late to prevent the woman from falling from the sadle, but that didn't stop her from attempting to help and calling out for her husband.

-----

Eva's mind stirred slowly and she then awoke with a start, sitting up and trying to adjust her eyes to the dim glow from the basement of the hovel she was in.
"Didn't think you'd be up with such a start" Came an elderly voice from behind. Eva looked around with a start to see the owner of the voice, an old nordic woman with grey hair, walking down the stairs with a pitcher in her hand.
"Thank you" Eva said, nodding her head"
"Your an imperial. I didn't think you'd butcher me after I was done fixing you up"
"And a grand job you've done looking after me" Eva said, smiling lightly and turning to sit on the edge of her bed.
"Now now, don't get up to quickly. Going to take a while to weed that poison out of your system"
"Poison?" Eva asked with alarm.
"A combination of honeycomb and Deathbell. Both substances are easy to come by so its easy to fix. Found it had entered through that arm wound of yours" The woman said, jabbing it with her finger. Eva winced in pain. So that explained why she became tired so quickly. An awkwardness held in the air for a few seconds.
"I'm Eva" Eva said, making a light informal curtsey to the woman.
"Ingvild" The elderly woman said, completely straightfaced and unmoving. "Thorvald should be upstairs finishing up with dinner. Come and share it with us"

-----

Dinner was far better than any legion rations Eva had been given. Chicken had been thrown into a pot with a wide assortment of vegetables and mixed together to form a rather tasteful stew. Although the liquid was slightly thick, it gave a delicious edge to it, locking in the flavour.
"So tell me, Eva" Thorvald said, finishing his portion and helping himself to more. "How does a legionaire like you end up unconscious on our doorstep?". Thorvald had an extremely thick nordic accent which for a moment made a few words difficult to understand.
"Former legionaire" Eva said quietly. Thorvald stared blankly at her.
"Why'd you leave?" He asked flatly.
"I was released from active service on account of fradulent behaviour" Eva said, clearly annoyed at the reason.
"Fradulent?" Thorvald said, his emotion unchanging.
"Apparently a deep hatred for the white gold concordat counts as fradulent behaviour... That and locking a senior member of the Thalmor in his room"
Thorvald rumbled a deep laugh in his belly. He reached down his shirt, pulled something out and tossed it to Eva. It was a dragon in the shape of a diamond, the symbol of the legion.
"They gave me that when I retired. But I'm still a legionaire. Deep down, so are you"

Suddenly, there was a knock on the door: "Thalmor Justiciars! Open up now!" Came a voice from outside.
15211.title: A farm! Somewhere to stop and rest at...

choices: You can stay and work on the farm here if you want...
You can't stay here sorry, its not safe...
152111.content:
Thorvald briefly looked at Ingvild, who understood immediately. She hurred to get Eva downstairs and hidden behind a dozen barrels in the back of the cellar. Thorvald stalled for a few seconds before opening the door to the Justiciars.
"What do you want Elf?" He asked brutishly. Eva could hear everything through the floorboards but couldnt see upstairs.
"There is a renegade in the area, wanted for high treason. You wouldnt be harbouring a felon... Would you?" Said the Justiciar, suspicious from the start.

All Thalmor had been like this. Ever since they were given free reign to go wherever they chose, they had been extremely arrogant, actively proclaiming their own strength over humans and the like.
"I'm a farmer" Thorvald said. "What would I achieve by hiding a felon except getting in trouble?"
"Then if your so sure of yourself, I'm sure you wouldnt mind us looking around" The elf said. Eva could hear him push Thorvald out of the way.

The only sound that came from upstairs was the sound of metalclad feet on the wooden flooring. Eva sat perfectly still, muttering a silent prayer to the divines. One of the thalmor had come downstairs now and was searching around. She could see through a narrow gap in the barrels that he clearly was sure that nothing of interest was down here. He began walking back upstairs but just at the last second, turned for another look.

Five minutes later, the clearly annoyed Thalmor left the farmhouse and continued down the track.
Ingvild fetched Eva and all three sat down at the table again.
"Well that was enjoyable" Thorvald said with mock amusement. Ingvild didnt say anything. "So, any plans for where you are going?"
"In truth, no idea" Eva said.
152111.title: Ingvild hides you in a barrel downstairs.

choices: Break the news to Thorvald and Ingvild slowly...
1521111.content:
"Well then. We can either send you on your way with a few supplies, or you can stay here and help on the farm. I'll even pay you but the wages will be measly at best" Thorvald said, taking a drink from his mug. Ingvild certainly brightened at the idea.
"It'd be nice to have extra company around for a while" She said brightly.

"Well then it's a deal" Eva said happily.

-----
Six Months Later
-----

Eva cut the scythe through the tall blades of wheat, quickly gathering it up before it scattered before the wind. She stopped for a minute, wiped her brow and looked up. The hot sun beat down on her and a few beads of sweat had already gone down her face and dropped to the dry ground.

Although the farm itself was relatively small, there was always plenty to do. Eva had seen farmers all her life, but never realised just how much work was involved in growing food. Looking back down, she continued to cut the wheat and pile it into a small wheelbarrow. Thorvald had happily shown her exactly what to do and became extremely relieved to see the work be divided from two people into three, thus making everything much easier. Ingvild on the other hand had taken to showing Eva how to prepare delicious meals with only the most basic ingredients.

Putting the last of the wheat in the wheelbarrow, Eva picked up the handles and wheeled it over to the small grindstone where Thorvald was busy hard at work pushing it around. If they were any richer, Thorvald would have long ago built a windmill so that it was air powered rather than man powered. Sadly, they werent exactly the richest family and as such, had to resort to either Thorvald or Eva pushing it.
"Take a break Thorvald" Eva said. "You pile this stuff in and I'll keep pushing"
Thorvald stopped pushing at looked up at Eva. While Eva may have had a few beads of sweat from the mornings work, Thorvalds face was covered in it.
"Thanks" He said, taking his hands off the handle.

Eva got down and started pushing it around. Around and around. Each time she passed Thorvald, he piled more wheat inside to be ground down. In the city, flour was always in great demand whereas ordinary wheat was practically unsellable.

Nearly two hours later, the last of the flour was scooped up and dropped into the full bag. Thorvald tied the bag with a piece of rope and hauled it onto the horse pulled cart.
"You know, before you were here, it'd take me all day to do this. I wouldnt get the last bag on there till sundown"
"Well, there's always plenty more to be done. I havent started uprooting the carrots or potatoes yet" Eva smiled. Thorvald eyed her carefully.
"An hours break first" He said, heading into the house.

While Ingvild and Thorvald prepared a small lunch, Eva headed down to her bedroom. At least, that's what she called it. Technically it was just a small rug strewn over straw with a chest beside it, but it was all Eva had now. The horse she rode in was now in the care of Thorvald who used it to pull the cart to and from the city. Eva's weapons and armour were now resting in the chest and she cleaned them on a regular basis.

When she had left Cyrodiil, she had only brought a small bag of coins with her. Last she counted, the bag was filled with five hundred septims. Having worked for Thorvald and Ingvild for the last few months had earned her a further one hundred and fifty three, bringing her to a grand total of six hundred and fifty septims.

The work at the farm had been good, but Eva was eventually coming to terms with the fact that she would soon need to leave. That party of Thalmor were still lurking around The Pale and it was only a matter of time before they discovered that Eva had actually been with the farmers all this time...
1521111.title: You can stay and work on the farm here if you want

choices: Ask if the dagger is his...
15211111.content:
Eva headed upstairs to lunch and sat down at the table with Ingvild and Thorvald. Ingvild dished up the broth and they began eating slowly.
"Thorvald, Ingvild... There's something I need to talk to you about" Eva said slowly, trying to get some courage. Thorvald stopped pouring his drink and looked up at her.
"Aye?" He asked. Ingvild eyed Eva carefully.
"You two are both great people but... I think it may be time for me to move on" Eva said. Thorvald put the pitcher down and looked at Ingvild.

"I knew this would happen" He said, turning to Eva. "It's been good having you here. When were you planning on heading out? We can provide you with a pack full of things to keep you going."
"Tomorrow morning. I'm a wanderer, always have been."
"Then we'll make sure to have a good dinner then" Ingvild said, a distant smile on her face. Eva knew she didn't want her to go, but it had to be so.

That evening, they feasted on thick chunks of pork, freshly slaughtered from one of the pigs round behind the farmhouse. The delicious meat was supplimented by fresh apples, lettuce and cold carrots. On the whole, it was quite nice.
That night, Eva found it difficult to get to sleep, the thoughts of the journey ahead swam in her mind, as well as the thoughts of what she was leaving behind.

-----
Eva waved goodbye to Thorvald and Ingvild and headed down the path. Thorvald had fixed her up a nice backpack made of tough leather and sheep's wool. Inside was a loaf of bread, a few apples, some dried pieces of ham and a few utensils and a small lightweight cooking pot. Although it was decently heavy, Eva was easily used to the weight thanks to working for the Imperial Army.

She started walking down the path. Riften was easily a two day walking journey and judging by the height of the sun, it was roughly Ten In The Morn.

The journey was completely uneventful and Eva found a long straight stick on the side of the road to use as a hiking pole. Eventually, she walked over a rise and saw the large expanse of the lake outside Riften. Riften itself was just over the edge of the horizon and it would take almost a full day to walk around the lake. Besides, the sun was already quite low and Eva suddenly realised that she had walked pretty much the whole day without eating.

She sat down on a fallen log just off the road and began to rummage through her bag, finding and pulling out an apple and then biting down onto it's jucy flesh.

All of a sudden, she was approached by a man in furs who looked worried.
"Here take this and hide it!" He said, not giving Eva a chance to respond. "I'll be back for it later, don't lose it or i'll kill you!"
"Hey, stop!" Eva called to the man who was still running. But it was hopeless, he had already gone round a corner and was lost from sight.
She sat back down on the log and examined the steel dagger. Overall, it was completely unremarkable but it had an odd reddish tint to the blade.
"It's enchanted" She murmured. "Wonder what's been done to it"

Almost as if on cue, Eva was approached by a different man, this time clad in a leather jerkin with a bow in his hands. The only noticeable feature about him was the scar down his left cheek and the nose which must have been broken several years ago as it hadnt reset into the right place. If it wasnt for that, he'd be quite handsome. "Did you see someone come past here a short while ago?" He asked, clearly out of breath.
15211111.title: Break the news to Thorvald and Ingvild slowly...

152111111.content:
"Yea, he told me to hide this." Eva said, holding the dagger up. "I presume it's yours?"
"Aye, it is, thanks" He said, holding it hand out. Eva put the hilt in his hand.
"Thanks! Did you see where the bastard went?" He asked.

Eva stood up and pointed in the direction of where the fur clad man had run. "Down that way" She said, "But I don't know how far. Lost sight of him round the bend"
"Good enough. I'm gonna kill him for this." The man said, annoyed. But before he went, he pulled out a septim and flicked it to Eva. "Thanks" He said, and ran off.

The whole event had taken only five minutes.
"Well that was interesting" She murmured. She sat back down on the log and finished eating her apple.
Having finished it down to the core, she threw the dead husk away into the forest. The sun was still settling over the horizon and Eva decided to use the remaining light to find a better camping spot. She was all too aware of the fact that bears roamed the wilds in country so she found a slight dip behind some bushes that would mask her from sight.

Unravelling her bedroll, Eva finished off her meagre dinner with a few pieces of smoked fish and then rolled up in her makeshift bed and soon fell asleep.

-----

It was early morning when Eva awoke, sitting up and stretching her arms out. A loud yawn escaped from her mouth before she had even begun to think. It was natural for Eva to wake early on any morning and the sun had only just peaked over the horizon. A perfect time to continue walking. Eva ate another apple from her bag, packed up her bedroll and picked up her hiking pole.

The sun had risen high in the sky and it was almost midday when Riften finally came into sight. The road had snaked off away from the lake for a while and Eva was surprised to discover just how close she was to the city now. Looking to her left, she found a small group of islands out on the lake, a mansion occupying the biggest one with bridges connecting each island to the mainland. Another hour later and the southern gate of Riften was in sight, a lone guard was leaning against the wall. He stood to attention as Eva approached. Clearly he didnt trust her, as his hand rested on the hilt of his sword, sheathed by his side.

"Greetings!" Eva called out in a friendly manner.
"This gate is closed" The guard said firmly, obviously not caring for Eva's greeting.
"Oh, why so?" She asked.
"Not my problem. Go around to the main gate"
"Sorry, I'm new to these parts. Whats the easiest way to get there then?"

Despite the helmet completely covering the guards face, Eva was fairly certain that he was staring at her.
"Around that way" He said, pointing to the east.
"Thanks" She said happily, heading in the direction he indicated.

It took a further two hours to go around the city, Riftens walls were high and long. However Eva did notice that they didn't appear to be thick. They looked like they were just to keep unwanted people out.
"Or in..." She muttered to herself.

Finally, she approached the maingate. There was a stable just outside and two guards standing at the door. The same as the other gate, they both appeared bored. One of them took a few steps towards her.
"Hello!" Eva called out happily.
"Welcome to Riften traveller. You heading inside?" He asked.
"Aye, that I am"
"Great. That's ten septims" The guard said.
"Sorry, what?" Eva asked, confused.
"Ten septims to enter the city. Entrance tax. One off"
Eva was stunned. This had never happened in any city she had ever been to - and she had travelled across most of Tamriel.
"Surely this is a shake down?" She asked. The guard stood solid, his hand still outstretched wanting the money. Eva rolled her eyes and produced the requested gold.
"Excellent. Enjoy your stay in Riften traveller, don't cause any fuss" The guard said, putting the coins in a small wooden box on the ground.
Eva didn't reply as she entered through the large wooden gates.

The great city of Riften now stood before Eva in all it's less than intoxicating glory. Two options stood out before Eva
152111111.title: Ask if the dagger is his...

1521111111.content:
The first thing that came to mind was the need for some half decent gear at the blacksmith. Eva had been forced to leave her military armour back at the farmhouse and as such, had travelled in a simple attire of a long sleeved dark blue tunic with a black apron. Although it was very comfortable to wear, it would definately not be of any value in keeping her alive in an armed fight.

Eva strode through town, all to aware of the fact that people appeared to be unusually silent, though nobody appeared to be looking cautiously at her. Having crossed through the marketplace, Eva reached the blacksmith. A man was at the anvil, hammering a piece of metal into shape. He briefly stopped, looked it over and then tossed it into a trough of cold water.
"Hail!" She said. The blacksmith turned to her.
"Greetings traveller! Names Balimund. Have you come to trade?" The blacksmith responded in a thick nordic accent.
"Indeed I have" Eva said. "I'll need a full fitting for some armor"
"Aye, that's expensive depending on what your looking for... Could you tell me what you'd be wanting?"
"Something with a decent level of protection. Perhaps some steel?"
"Ah, good ol' fashioned nordic steel. That'll stop the blow of many weapons. What kind though; ordinary or plate? Plate is far stronger, but it's more expensive and heavier. Of course, if you've got the gold, I've got the equipment"
"I was told that if I provided ingots, it would lower the cost?"
"Aye madam, that it would. Though if you've got all the metal you need, you might as well do it yourself."

Eva held up a hand to stop him. She didn't really know anything about metalworking. "It's fine" She said, and produced a single steel ingot from her backpack. She handed it to Balimund and he studied it carefully.
"Hmph... Looks like it's in fine condition. Alright, that'll knock off the price a little. Come inside and see what we have in stock."

Eva followed Balimund inside his shop. There were several questions asked and comments exchanged about size, shape and weight. Eventually, Eva happily settled on a steel curiass with pauldrons, steel gloves, steel boots and a steel helmet with a chainmail neck guard. Overall, she was happy with her purchase and the ingot had knocked off the price somewhat. Rather than paying a near five hundred septims, she had settled on four hundred. All of the armour pieces also were covered in the traditional nordic carvings which distingushed them from armour's in other parts of Tamriel. Balimund let Eva get changed in another room and she came out very happy with her purchase.

"Pleasure doing business with you." Balimund said, finally taking the gold from her. "Feel free to stop by any time"
"Thanks Balimund. I'm sure you've made this armour well"

Eva left the blacksmith's shop and headed back outside into the cool fresh air. Now, her first task was done.

1551.content:
Name: Vulunslad
Species: Dragon

Age: 183
Size: 19'2" talon to horns while leaning forward, 58'6" wingspan
Gender: Male
Magic (Thu'um): Bend Will, Disarm, Dismay, Drain Vitality, Frost Breath, Ice Form, and Soul Fog.
Weapon: Tooth and claw
Description: A fearsome drake with a nearly black hue of scales almost on par with Alduin himself, yet with dark blue accents denoting the characteristics of a winter wyrm. While the scars of battle are evident across his body, none of these old wounds have even pierced the thick, naturally scaled armor that shields his limbs.

Biography: A relatively young dragon in comparison to the ages of his kin, his ferocity and cunning in battle earned Vulunslad a fearful recognition during the Dragon War as Alduin's new right wing lieutenant after the betrayal of Paarthurnax to mankind. By the time he had fallen during the intensity of the final battle, he was surrounded by the bodies of dozens of revolting Nords and traitor dragons that sought to slay him. He would not fall without taking a toll and even with his dying breath, he was not satisfied... Now, as he rises from the ashes of his burial tomb during his revival by Alduin, he seeks to sate his thirst.

So, what now?
1551.title: An Antagonist

15511.content:
There was only darkness, unraveling and sifting, revealing naught but more emptiness. A perilous mental continuum was the least direct way to describe this state. One could only guess how long this perpetuated for... But then there was a feeling of movement, very rigid, yet still considerable in comparison to his past lack of sensation.

The darkness was still there, but Vulunslad could feel solid ground, the rigidness of the dirt.

"...Tiid~ Vo!"

Above himself, he could hear the words for "time" and "undo" come from a very familiar voice. When he had finally regained his vision, he saw the ebony-black wings of Alduin beating far off into the horizon, towards the West. Vulunslad knew that this time would finally come and the waiting developed the ire within him to roaring extent.

Before he came to the recognition that Skyrim had changed to a great extent from the times long past, something caught his attention. To his left, he heard a shaky, rattling gasp; apparently a younger Nordic farmhand clad in leather was chasing after a runaway stead, where both the farmhand and the horse bore witness to the whole event. An emptiness gnawed at Vulunslad and he knew that he did not fully recover his energy.

He began to utter the words, "Gaan, Lah... Haas!" towards the duo, with utmost emphasis on the word 'Haas', meaning 'health'. As soon as he did so, the horse collapsed unto the ground and ceased to move. The farmhand was a little more fortunate, only losing his breath for a second and forcefully regaining it the next. Wide-eyed, the Nord just stared at his aggressor.

Feeling a wonderful resurgence within himself from the gained life-force, Vulunslad peered deeply into the farmhand and simply put, "I must thank you for your tribute... It has been a long time since one such as yourself gave an offering to me. For that, you may live. Now go and tell the world of my, Vulunslad's, return!"

With silent haste, the farmhand scrambled out of the passage and fled while clutching his chest. As Vulunslad turned away, he glimpsed towards the north to see a large lake-side settlement to the north, just past the horizon. While he did not know that the place was called Riften, he knew what his next goal was as he gazed intently at his future dominion.
15511.title: Resurrection

155111.content:
Only a decree of heavenly establishment could sway Vulunslad from his path of intent. His strength was regained and his mind was clear, for once.

As he reared back and took to flight, he noticed a vaguely memorable structure dug deep into the snows close to his burial ground; Forelhost. As far as he had known, it was the last bastion for the cult followers during the final moments of the war. He cracked a small laugh during his flight. It was amusing that the victors of the war never took the place apart or, at least, caved it in. Something else caught his attention from above: a blazing campfire just in front of Forelhost's entrance, with what appeared to be a tall elf changing between two vastly different armor sets next to the tent.

With a powerful landing, Vulunslad swooped down beside the camp, shaking the ground with such force that nearly knocked the elf over. A sudden glance of shock came over the high elf's face as he reactively grabbed his weapon from his side. With preemptive confidence, Vulunslad merely spat the first word of his thu'um "Zun!" for 'weapon' and the elf's hand axe was sent flying into the snow behind him. In moments, the unarmed and terrified fighter was yelling for mercy, saying, "No! I beg of you, I do not know what you want, but spare me!"

Vulunslad contemplated this offer. He responded to the elf, simply putting, "I seek knowledge. Tell me about the settlement to the north of this tomb."

"The settlement!? Y-you mean Riften? The Nords call it a haven for thieves and corruption... But that's all I know! I swear!" the elf shakily said.

The drake grinned for a moment. Riften. Thievery in plain sight and behind closed doors. A locale just waiting for a change, with hardly any opposition... A rather low start for a new domain, but Vulunslad was already interested. He gave a demeaning gaze towards the elf and said, "I can see that you value your life. However, it is already within my grasp. If you want it back, then you shall buy it with anything of value that you find within this derelict tomb of times long past. Your payment will be taken upon my return here." As soon as the dragon took to the air once more, the elf began to think about his current predicament and hastily ran to the snow behind his camp in search of his lost weapon.

Away from the mountains and ancient burial grounds, Vulunslad peered deeply at the town of Riften from above, with its high walls and large docking platforms. At this height, he could see the outlining buildings, stalls in the town center, and the lower-level moats of water running through the bottom of the area. After an initial scan, he seized his perch directly on top of the high wall behind a forge on the western side of the center. Shouts of 'Dragon!' and the running of numerous citizens could be heard below. Soon enough, every guard in sight was readying a bow aimed directly at the ensuing threat. Before any arrow could be fired, Vulunslad calmly pronounced his presence with one of his favorite thu'ums, bellowing, "Faas, Ru... Maar!". As soon as the sound vibrated across the cityscape, anyone left wielding a weapon in his vision was madly fleeing to safety from the dragon. Vulunslad grinned in satisfaction. It was a long, long time since he was able to insinuate mass fear before.

However, his grin quickly turned to a frown of denial. There, almost directly below him, elapsed in his ecliptic shadow over the forge alongside the high wall was a warrior who was not fleeing. Rather, the warrior bore the same surprised frown as Vulunslad did. There was something... different about this warrior. The thoughts were racing through the dragon's mind; Magic? No, no magic could stand against the might of a fully mastered thu'um. Was it a Daedra? No, those demonic incantations were chased towards the ends of Tamriel. But then... What...
